Reviews.Title: “More for the younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: travelnaps
Reviews.Content: The Palms Place is nice, but that is about the best I can do to describe it. It does not compare to some of the higher end casinos like Mandalay Bay or the Mirage. Some hotel staff were nice and others not so much. The rooms are nice, but a little old and showing use. I had upgraded to the studio suite and there was plenty of room for my wife and I. It had 3 tv's, a jacuzzi tub, and a full kitchen. When I arrived, my room was not cleaned properly and I had to call house keeping. They arrive within a few minutes and rectified the problem. I only really have two complaints: 1. They charge a $20 resort fee, but when I went to use the gym I was told I need to use the gym in the other tower of the Palms or pay an additional $25 per person. Doesn't the resort fee cover that? It was a 5 - 7 minute walk to the other gym. This walk is the same walk that you need to do everytime you decide to journey from your room in the Palms Place to the casino...it gets a little old quickly. On a side note, the gym was very nice. 2. I purchased the room through Amazon.com which provided a great price and value with several little extras. The problem was the hotel had no idea what they sold me. I had to show them a printout of all the things it included. All and all, it was a nice weekend in Las Vegas, but this casino is really targeting the 21 - 30 age group. They playrap music in the hallways all day long. I have nothing against rap music, but at 7 am, it becomes a little much.

Reviews.Title: “Resort lacking basic fundamentals”
Reviews.Author: bfresh4u
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort in mid April (5 days) but couldn't rate any higher than average. #1. hallways remind me of the W - need better lighting in the lobby elevator area #2. no literature in the suites (no magazines, no comment cards) #3. pool menu - what an shame, no appetizers to speak of #4. concierge - research required If this resort wants guests to spend money at their resort, they need to go back to the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms and views”
Reviews.Author: angelauk
Reviews.Content: I have just go back from staying at the Palms Place in a Studio Room and it was a very nice stay so please don't let all the negative comments put you off. Here are my main points: 1, This is not an elderly persons hotel - they may not appreciate the dark lift area with pretty loud music in the lifts. Fantastic modern rooms with a fabulous huge bathroom with tv and jacuzzi. Kitchen very well appointed and the maid even washed our glasses for us too ! There were a few maintenance issues that we tried to report but either there was no answer or no one came quickly enough if I did get through. there were no bathrobes as promised but they brought us some on request very quickly. However they were taken away the next day and not replaced as they had RUN OUT !!! Not good enough. Have never had such a great room and would definitly recommend it - we found it very clean ! Maybe we were lucky ! The Ghost bar on the top of the Palms has the best view in the world !

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: George X
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple nights in April 2012. The room was nice but there were several issues. The room was not very clean and there was a fair amount of hair in the washroom. There was also several broken items in the room. On our last day there the shower broke and only had very hot water. The valet service wasn't that good either. So unless you get a smokin deal there are better places in Vegas to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very drunk men, scantily clad women and don't rely on the concierge for ANYTHING”
Reviews.Author: IrvineHarley
Reviews.Content: Ok. So the hotel is the playboy hotel in Las Vegas (no...I didn't know it until I arrived as a wedding guest) so I guess I can't complain about the packs of drunk young men trolling the lobby. And given the playboy association, I suppose I should not complain about the twenty-something young woman who got into the elevator in a skimpy gold bathing suit with matching high heels with my 70 something year old dad. But you would think the concierge would be someone with knowledge of the restaurants on the property if not some nearby establishments. The young lady was very nice but could not even give directions to restaurants IN THE BUILDING. Shoot me now! The doormen were nice and Simon's restaurant was a fairly peaceful oasis with a tasty breakfast but this hotel was not my taste and I would not recommend it to anyone other than rambunctious, randy frat boys. Oh, by the way, our room was clean, contrary to another recent review so maybe the hotel at least got THAT message.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: PattyB3
Reviews.Content: it has a great pool and the food is so good. The restaurants are great too, the price of the food is good for the amount of food you are serve, the buffets, the breakfast selection is great. The rooms are really good size. The movie theather is great because you do not have to drive anywhere. we enjoyed the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sewer Room”
Reviews.Author: Elyse1316
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights on Jetsetter one week ahead, so this was a bit of a last minute trip. Booking a regular one bedroom suite seemed like a good deal in comparison to the price hikes we tracked throughout the week. Upon checking in, my boyfriend upgraded to a penthouse with an outdoor hot tub. We were stoked. As he checked in before my arrival, he noticed the off-putting smell in the room. I arrived two hours later and also noticed it as he was dining downstairs in the restaurant. I called housekeeping and a nice staff member came in to spray some solution within the room and it did the trick for a little while. I left the room to meet my boyfriend and when we returned, so did the smell. We called down again and another housekeeping agent came in and was pretty blown away by the smell. She said there wasn't much they can do other than to put wet towels on the drains. As she surveyed the situation, my boyfriend tried to resolve the issue with the front desk staff, to no avail. We are patient people, but the smell was starting to get to us and we were hoping our clothes wouldn't start to have the same stench. Long story short is the smell was not subsiding, the front desk staff didn't seem to believe us and we went out that night, slept in the stinky room and finally demanded to be moved at 10am the next morning. This whole issue may have not left such a bad taste (literally) in our mouths had the staff handled the issue and understood our issue and apologized. As a hotel guest, all you ever want is the person on the other end of the line (or desk) to be accommodating and understanding. We are very nice people and recognize when patrons are being irrational and mean. We are not like that. When we finally got the new room, we were told to leave our bags in our original room and they would be moved for us to the new room. That did not happen. When we called to the front desk, they questioned why we left the bags in the room. The staff member literally said, "Who asked you to keep the bags in the room?". Our response, "The manager". Why in the world would they question who told us to leave the bags? Why not just tell us that they will send someone to get them. Again, another interaction in which the staff clearly does not understand how to resolve issues with customers. I would like to say if it weren't for the sewer and staff issue, I could probably give a more favorable review, at least up to 3 stars. Our second room was fine.. good in size, comfortable bed, great shower. You can tell the appointments and decor was used on the budget side of things as the carpet is frayed, knicks and chips are visible, however, I can overlook those details. The hotel upkeep is just not at the standard of other properties we have stayed at, windows are completely filthy and grimey and the elevators have seen better days. The pool is nothing special either. If you just want sun, it's a totally fine place as the chairs are comfortable. There are plenty of families and kids, which for Vegas is not my scene, but I can see how that may appeal to some. I will say the most positive thing about the hotel is the restaurant and bar staff, both in the Simon restaurant and the pool. Great and friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: rhondy114
Reviews.Content: Fell in the shower. Called down to front desk, asked for an ice pack. 20 mins later bell boy shows up with a little bucket of ice! Really? Ice machine was literally right next to our room. Pretty sure I could have done THAT myself! Told him I asked for an ice pack bcuz I fell in the shower. He said he was "pretty sure they didn't have anything like that" and I "should call housekeeping bcuz they have the plastic bags they put in the ice buckets". Upon checking out, told the guy I fell in the shower. He asked if I wanted to speak with the mgr. Told him the concern would have been nice 2 hours ago but I had to be somewhere. He verified my phone number and said the mgr would be calling me. Never heard from anyone. Called 4 days later, spoke to Brian who assured me the "risk mgr" would be calling me. Still waiting for that call!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but I will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: J_Waggoner1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Las Vegas that we booked through LasVegas.com. I will never book with LasVegas.com again, we thought they had a great rate through LasVegas.com than found out about the fees they don't tell you about. The Resort charges $20. a day resort fee than charges you an additional $25.00 to use the gym. They also charge your credit card a $100.00 a day deposit. So if you have a budget as to what you can spend than this is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably an amazing hotel, 5 years ago!”
Reviews.Author: SINCLAIRTHETRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fabulous. Extremely spacious, with floor to ceiling windows and great views. My wife and I, stayed in the One bedroom suite with two bathrooms. The room, unfortunately, was a little rundown. You can tell, the Palms Hotel, is having money problems. Holes in the walls, speakers falling off the televisions, burn holes in the carpets, no pots or pans for a "state of the art" kitchen, etc. But, the rooms are extremely beautiful and very modern. When we first arrived in our room, we immediately noticed one of the speakers on the side of the t.v. was completely hanging off by a wire. We called the front desk to notify them and said, don't worry about fixing it now because we have family and friends here, but I just wanted to make sure that they make a note of it so that we didn't get charged for the damage. They said, no problem, and made a note of it. Of course, upon receiving our bill at the end of the week, what was on there, the cost of the damage for the speaker. Unbelievable! I explained about calling down and the fact that there should have been a note explaining the details of this and, of course, no note, nothing. The front desk service was horrible for NOT doing anything but standing around. I would call downstairs to the front desk and the phone would just ring and ring and ring. No one would answer the phone. It would ring for minutes on end, and still nothing. Eventually, the pool would pick up. How is the pool going to answer my questions about pots and pans? LOL. The elevators are a joke. Nothing but problems with the room keys. Get rid of the key insert, Palms. it's causing more headaches than not. I also called down for an extra blanket, which they replied, we're all out. Are you kidding me, you're all out. Don't tell me, every room in this hotel is taken, get off your butts and go into another room and grab me a blanket. Rocket science for these people, I tell ya. Parking was convenient. Right outside and always a spot. The pool is a joke. Nowhere to sit and if you want to sit, you'll have to pay for it. I think it was $25.00 a day. Can you believe that, charging your customers to sit at the pool? And just for that, i didn't spend a single penny at the pool. Normally, I would have bought food and drinks, but because of that, I went upstairs and filled my tumbler up with drinks and made myself a sandwich. Businesses today, are so stupid. They just don't get it. Would I return, NO. Mostly, because of the terrible service and paying to sit at the pool. That was a complete turnoff for my wife and I. Was it the worst hotel ever, NO, but it wasn't up to standards with where they should be.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for two weeks - Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: WytzeNL
Reviews.Content: Just spent two weeks in one of the 1BR suites at this tower, which is right next to the Palms. Great stay. Housekeeping did a great job, they even cleaned our kitchen when we made a mess out of it and supplied us with all necessities like dishwashing and washing powder. Internet was kind of slow at times - but it was included in the resort fee for all our devices (4). Beds we're amazing. Location is a little off the strip, technically but even on the strip you need to taxi from one end to another so it's no biggie. Resort fee includes access to the gym in the Palms which only has cardio equipment. Hotel management was kind enough to give us a few passes to the gym inside Palms Place which was totally awesome. Palms Place is definitely recommended for a longer stay in Vegas and I'll be back soon probably. If they fix the slower internet and include fulltime access to the palmsplace gym or include some weights in the Palms gym I'd be able to give 5 stars. Also would have been nice if we were able to open the windows in the suites for some fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to have fun with your friends”
Reviews.Author: Brandon C
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the hotel at about 7:30PM, There was no line and we checked in, in less than 3 minutes. Room was great! we had a great view. The beds were very comfortable, I slept on the pullout and I have to say it was very comfortable, but that just might be because I was very drunk. There were 6 guys in one room and we were all very comfortable. The taxi ride to the strip was about $10 to Cosmopolitan where we went to Marquee the first night. Second night we walked over to the Palms and went to ghost bar, we got in free with our room key and a pass we received from the concierge. We also got free admission to playboy, moon and Rain, so that was a major perk.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Angelina D
Reviews.Content: We booked the two bedroom suite for last weekend. Upon arrival we were confused as we could not find an adjoining door. It was essentially two rooms next to each other (separate room numbers, just as normal separate rooms. How they say it combines is there are two double doors outside in the hallway you can close and then prop both room doors open. This still by definition is not a two bedroom suite and of course nothing on the website shows the floor plan or indicates that you are getting two rooms as obviously anyone looking to stay as a group in a 2 bedroom suite does not want two rooms. We would have stayed on the strip in two separate rooms rather than at this hotel so it was a huge disappointment and the manager really had nothing to say as it's obviously false advertising for such an expensive room. Room was also dirty upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Palms Place Hotel & Spa, Las Vegas, NV”
Reviews.Author: sharpshots
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay (April 1-4, 2012) at the Palms Place Hotel in Las Vegas. We picked this hotel due to the reasonable nightly rate ($79/89/night +). The rooms are actually condos and they are huge. Large bath room with shower & whirlpool tub, all marble tiled; a reasonably stocked kitchenette (no coffee maker) with small fridge, stove, microwave, dishes, etc.; huge floor-ceiling windows and a huge balcony (no access, doors locked for safety). We had a lovely view of the strip but unfortunately couldn't access the balcony for the full effect. Bed was king size and extremely comfortable. So overall we would give the room itself a fairly high score. Now for other aspects....the Palms Place pool are is small, but nice, but a fancy type restaurant is right along one side of the pool, so when you are laying in the sun, in pool or hot tub, people are RIGHT there watching you. Sort of a weird feeling. THey have a pool bar and attendant to bring you drinks - great! But the "so called" music they play LOUDLY out there, and throughout the entire hotel is "headbanging" music. HORRIBLE!!!! YIKES!!! Only early 20s kids MIGHT appreciate it. Unfortunately this music follows you into the elevators, hallways, the sky tube into the Palms Hotel & Casino, everywhere. Take lots of Excedrin if you stay there. The hallways to the rooms are very dark, so much so you can't even see your room numbers. Maybe someone thinks that's sophisticated but.... This darkness, along with the headbanging music follows you thru the Sky Tube (long hallway) that connects the Palms Place to the Palms Casino & Hotel. At night walking back to the Palms Place is a rather daunting/uneasy, etc. experience. The majority of the patrons (or people/kids) we saw in the Sky Tube, elevators, hallways were young 20 somethings, many carrying cases of beer & alcohol to rooms for parties, and many we didn't feel comfortable getting into elevators with (and didn't). Once in the Palms Casino are it is nice that you can find the Coffee Bean, McDonalds, forzen yogurt bar, and many other decent restaurants/eating/drinking spots. It is away from the Strip but we did walk it one beautiful day. We broke it up with a stop at Sonic Burger, Gold Coast, & the Rio. THere is a very nice sidewalk all the way to the Strip. The hotel does, supposedly have a Free shuttle to the strip. THe hotel also charges a $20/day Resort Fee in addition to the room rate and taxes. What that is actually for, who knows??? Maybe to supply that "lovely" music. They should pay us! So make your own decision, but we will NOT stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment....!”
Reviews.Author: EastSideGirl
Reviews.Content: I wish we had read the Trip Advisor reviews before booking this hotel. The major problems are a lack of cleanliness (there were cookie crumbs all over the armrest of the sofa in our room, which made us wonder about the rest), a strong chemical smell in the hallways at all times, and the complete lack of amenities in the room. The walls were bare except for two flat screen TVs (overkill?), and there wasn't a flower, a magazine, or any other accessory to be seen. The room was minimal to a fault, and the windows were filthy. The lobby is one of the ugliest and least welcoming I have ever seen. The best thing about it was that we were there for only one night!

Reviews.Title: “Palms Place - Not good. Filthy room.”
Reviews.Author: TraceyPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at Palms Place. We are from Phoenix and travel to Vegas several times each year. This was our third stay on the “Palms” properties. The last two times we were in the Fantasy tower and this time we decided to upgrade to the newer Palms Place as we enjoy a condo style accommodation. We were extremely disappointed and will never return. Check in was smooth and quick but once we were settled into our studio suite we noticed it had not been cleaned properly. There was hair in the bathtub and all around the bathroom floor. Actually it appeared as though they did not even bother to clean the floors at all as there were crumbs all over the kitchen area and what appeared to be fingernail clippings and miscellaneous other filth around the base of the bed. I did not even want to be barefoot in the room. There were gross looking stains on the decorative pillows on the bed as well. We actually believe they were semen stains. How on earth housekeeping could place them back on the bed in that condition was hard to comprehend. We had to actually call housekeeping to come and remove them from the room. YUCK, YUCK, and YUCK! Over our 3 night stay we talked to 5 different front desk representatives about the filthy conditions (two of which were “managers”) and each time we were promised they would provide a complete cleaning service but never did. All they did was reluctantly remove the $20 per day resort fee which we had to remind them to do upon check-out. The location of the Palms is not convenient as it’s about ¾ mile from the strip and would be difficult to walk due to high traffic. Cab rides will run you $10 to $20 each way dependent upon traffic. The Palms does offer a shuttle service from 11:00 am to 8:00 pm but the bus only holds around a dozen persons and was often to full to accommodate everyone. There are many wonderful places to stay in Vegas. If you are looking for a condo style accommodation try the Signature or the Vdara. We will never return to the Palms and would never recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but too far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: prettykey
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, but it is too far of a journey from the Strip for me. The pool action in the summer is fun. The cabanas are a must. My friends and I stayed in adjoining suites. The suites were large enough and the bathrooms were quite spacious. Nice, clean, overall good place to stay if you don't mind having to take a taxi to the Strip. stayed may 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time at the pool and spa.”
Reviews.Author: uglychicano
Reviews.Content: We rented a cabana at the pool at Palms Place through TravelZoo. It was a great deal and came with a massage and body scrub. We spent the entire day there and had lunch and drinks and later, dinner. Very much enjoyed the helpful staff. I would do a spa day again there. For the record, I am a guy and usually don't do spa days.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Palms Place”
Reviews.Author: Atl1989
Reviews.Content: Palms Place was a great hotel for the value when we arrived it was a easy check in and the front desk gave helpful advice, it was great not being on the strip around all the people and noise, so the location was a plus. Only thing I didn't like about this hotel was the $15 resort fee. I wouldn't have a problem with this resort fee if we actually got something for it like free internet, newspapers, or at least water but you get really nothing. They did however give you a $15 coupon for free drinks at the bar but the bartenders seem not to like this coupon and will only give you one drink and take your entire $15 drink card (really one drink for $15). A tip if staying at this hotel is to get a rental that's good on gas and drive yourself around Vegas it will cut down alot on money for taxi's.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Randolph314
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palms Place for two nights. It was tolerable, certainly not the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. But there were a lot of flaws. To start with, they charge a rest fee of about $15. I know these fees are prevalent in Las Vegas, but that's minus one star right off the bat. It's simply a dishonest business practice and I wish the Nevada attorney general would do something about it. Second, they charge $15 a day for Internet (- another .5 stars). Any large American hotel billing itself as a luxury property should offer Internet access for little or no extra cost. And, the hotel also charged taxes of $30 a day that weren't disclosed on the Groupon I used. So in total we ended up paying something like $60 a day for stuff that should have been included in the room rate. As far as the hotel itself, the room was nice, but there were not enough elevators. Sometimes it took 5+ minutes for one to arrive and other times when one did arrive it was full. And the hotel had a really fratty feeling. Good if you're 19 and on spring break I guess, but not for everyone else. Also, the amenities are very sparse compared to other big Vegas hotels in terms of places to eat and stores. And of course the hotel's location isn't very central.

Reviews.Title: “Palms place stay in march 2012”
Reviews.Author: VanDesigner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palms place, but had booked at the palms tower and was upgraded to a studio suite on the 51st floor with a great view of the strip. Palms place is a nice, newer hotel that is quieter than the other towers of the Palms. It has all the benefits of the palms but Minus the casino (a bonus to us... Less smoke and less casino noise). The sky walk connects the Palms place to the casino and is not a far walk, maybe 3 min, but the elevator to the skywalk is slower than mud and adds to the journey. Staying at the palms in general, You will be paying extra for taxi rides, we estimated an extra $45 a day ($12 one way to the strip). So you will want to make sure you are getting a great deal to stay here. The shuttle does not run frequently so we didn't find it easy to use. Staff was friendly, except at ghost bar where bartenders had some serious attitude. Staying here we had comp'd entry to the bars so we left their attitudes and moved on. The rooms are nicely designed, but ours had some serious wear and tear. Sad that the upkeep of their new property is not a priority. Washrooms are large with beautiful shower and tub but the toilet is not separated. Beds comfortable! Rooms were cleaned everyday but you definitely could tell they were understaffed as some days we didn't have service till 5.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place off the strip”
Reviews.Author: DiveDivaDJ
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Palms Palace. It is non smoking, we stayed in a studio which had a kitchen with a fridge, lots of closets, NICE bathroom with a tv, King Bed with large screen tv, living area with another large screen TV. We paid $99 a night, not bad but then you are off the strip, if you want to cook this place is wonderful. Our view was boring compared to my brother in law who had a view of all the casinos and they got nice robes in their room, we must have got skipped. Vallet was great, room service was good. But remember if you don't have a car and plan on spending a lot of time on the strip, just pay the extra money and stay on the strip so you don't have to deal with the $$ taxi's as much. Palms Palace is clean, seemed safe, but seperate building than the casino not a bad walk. If you like to gamble & don't want to walk stay at the main Palms hotel or some where else. You are far from everything else, even if you are driving.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, little bit out of the way, but overall worth it”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandBrian
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the palms place are amazing. There is a little bit of a trek to get to the hotel, restaurants and casino to be in the middle of most of what the resort offers, but this also has its benefits as there is a more chilled out feel. The pool is beautiful, though can get windy. The staff were not always as helpful as I'd have liked. On the whole, if I was going back to Vegas tomorrow and the prices were comparable with other like sized and well known hotels, I wouldn't take the chance on a different but would be straight back to the Palms Place. I say again, great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lacking location”
Reviews.Author: HeatherBooksavvybabe
Reviews.Content: Thoughts on the Room: The room was fabulous. I can't talk it up enough. We were on the 36th floor, and we overlooked the Vegas Strip. At night, we had an amazing view of the city lights. There was a fireplace in the room, and since it happened to actually be cold while we were in town, the fireplace was very handy. The features and furniture was all very modern and contemporary, up to date, and chic. The room felt very high-class, with beautiful hardwood floors and marble bathrooms. The shower had double nozzles, and there was a separate half-bath as well. As for sleeping arrangements, there was a comfortable king sized bed as well as a pull-out full/queen sized couch bed. The beds were comfortable, given, the pull out bed was only as comfortable as a pull out bed can be (meaning it's not the most comfortable place to sleep, but it works). Also, the room came with a full kitchen- we had a refrigerator, freezer, pantry, plates and silverware. This came in very handy as we were able to keep snacks, drinks, and water in the room with us. This helped to not have to spend as much money on food, and we never had to go searching for $5 water bottles. The room was amazing, and when compared to other rooms/suites of the similar size and amenities, the price is appropriate. For the Bachelorette Party, there were quite a few girls coming and going, and this room was accommodating to everyone. We got the best deal for our dollar with this room. I rate the room ***** 5 Stars! Thoughts on service: I am also very impressed by the customer service at the hotel. We drove up Saturday and when we called about an early check in, there was a little bit of a mix up. However, when we arrived to check in, we had to wait, but the front desk got our room ready as fast as possible, and we only had to wait an hour. Considering the miscommunication, I felt that the front desk was extremely helpful and nice. The bell boys were also very friendly and accommodating. They were quick to help, and we never had to wait long for our car or a cab. When we asked for help to and from the room, the service was very quick, and again the bell hops were always friendly and eager to help. We did have to call housekeeping from time to time, and they were also helpful and the service was quick. We had no problem getting extra towels or blankets (Like I said, it was very cold the weekend we were there). The service was fantastic all around, I rate the service ***** 5 Stars! Thoughts on the Location: The Good: The good thing about the location of Palms Place is that it is connected to the Palms Casino. There is an indoor tunnel that leads from the elevators of Palms Place to the casino floor of the Palms. This made it convenient and easy to get to the Palms food court, movie theater, casino, and all the clubs in the Palms. The Bad: The Palms Place Hotel and the Palms Casino are located off the strip, too far to walk (especially for girls in cute shoes and high heels). It is not easy, or cheap, to get to the main Vegas strip. There is not a regular shuttle to take guests to the strip. Guests have to then pay for a cab or a limo, and as you can imagine, this really adds up in Vegas. Since I was with a larger party, we couldn't all fit in 1 cab, so it was either split up or take a more expensive limo. The far location from the strip is my NUMBER 1 complaint, which would not be a big deal if either the hotel or the casino had a regular shuttle. This is a major failing for the Palms. While the Palms is a fantastic casino, the location is not ideal. I rate the location ** 2 Stars. I think that I have covered all the main points. The Hotel itself is amazing, the rooms are fantastic, the service is wonderful. However, without a convenient shuttle to the main Vegas strip, the hotel really drops the ball. My overall rating for the Palms Place Hotel is *** 3 Stars (honestly, if they had a regular shuttle, this would be 4.5-5 stars).

Reviews.Title: “Palms Place is First Class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: MNVikings2011
Reviews.Content: I want to preface this review by stating that I've stayed at many hotels in Vegas (10 different to be exact with this being my 11th) and the Palms Place impressed me. If you have a strip view suite in the higher floors you have an amazing view of the strip. On the property (connected to Palms) there are many restaurants, bars, and good nightlife. You get free cover to the Ghost Bar, Moon, Rain, Playboy Club, and other clubs/bars/lounges for staying there. There are, however, a couple small downfalls to this hotel but the good outweighs the bad and it's not even close. We'll start with the good. Good: Palms Place is a newer trendy all suite and condo tower connected to the main Palms Casino/Resort. I enjoyed the modern decorations, the cleanliness of the hotel and the staff. The studio suite (inexpensive) is very nice. It has an all stainless steel kitchen. It includes, 2 fridges (one for mini bar and one for personal use that has a large icemaker built in - huge plus), dishwasher, and 2 burner stoves. Also, though, the cupboards come stocked with plates, cups, silverware, etc. The bathroom is also nice, the bed is comfy, and it has 3 plasma TV's including two that are roughly 50". There is also a balcony but you will find more about that below. All in all, I really enjoyed this hotel and their suites. Bad: This whole tower is non smoking and that I do not mind. However, the balconies are locked for non owners because of prior morons who have stayed there launching beer bottles, cigarette butts, etc. off their balcony and now they lock them. So although you have a wonderful balcony you can only look at it through window. Also, it is a bit of a walk to the main casino. They do have the moving sidewalks that helps though. If those two things don't bother you, then you will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cepedare
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palms Place from wed - sun for business and took some time for personal. the accomodations was incredible. The most ellegant room I have ever stayed in. The night life just inside this hotel was great! Access to all their clubs for free if you provide your room key as proof that you are staying there. Playboy Club was great! Ghost Club was Awesome! They also give you $15 vouchers per day to use in bars for drinking. Pretty much its 3 free beers a day. Awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Valgal123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palms Place resort this past weekend and had a very good experience. The lo-key Palms Place is one of the new fads Vegas has run away with. The non-smoking / non-gaming all suite hotel. I must say, I loved having a lot of space in our room with a kitchenette and not having to breathe in a cloud of smoke all weekend. We had to wait a while at the front desk before checking in, i didn't notice it but my boyfriend assured me someone said they would be right with us. The room had a nice modern feel and lot's of lighting. (which is usually lacking in Vegas hotels). The elevators are a little slow, but once we got up to our room on the 30th floor, the view alone was worth the wait. I have never had a view this great in Las Vegas. Palms Place is connected to the main Palms casino through a sky bridge and is also just a quick walk outside. There was a lounge in the lobby of Palms Place, but it seemed just like a stopping place before people headed out on the town for the evening. There was also a little store as well...I never went in but was comforted that it was there. Being off strip has it's advantages, we could park right in front of the hotel in an outdoor lot and not have to deal with valet or a multi-story parking garage. Getting around town was also easy because we could avoid traffic on the strip. Back to the room..the bed was So comfy and there were 3 TV's in the room. I couldn't get the TV in the bathroom to work and the hardwood floor in the sleeping area was awesome to look at, but incredibly squeaky and made it difficult to sneak around haha. The carpet in the sitting area felt very soft. We were wrongly accused of smoking in our room when checking out, but the charges were quickly reversed without hassle and we were on our merry way. Next time I'm in Vegas, the Palms Place will be my first choice. Close enough the action, but also far enough away...without smoke :) Side note: all of the black jack dealers at the Palms Casino were really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Mod”
Reviews.Author: mtspace
Reviews.Content: Judging from its spare, utilitarian lines and its quirky decoration this building was built in the the 1970's. It's not clear whether it was meant to typify the architectural mode of the day or lampoon it. Stainless steel kitchenettes and glass and marble bathrooms are placed near the entry. The sleeping area is in the center. A living area with low, mod furniture occupies the space by the wall-to ceiling windows. The whole wall above the bed is mirrored as if six people were sitting in the next room watching. Seemed a little creepy to me. The main light fixture is a spherical shade the size of a watermelon that looks like something out of Woody Allen's movie Sleeper. Other fixtures had dark maroon spherical shades. Again, very mod. And, did I mention that the walls in the hallways were black. Floor to ceiling. And so was the wooden plank flooring in the sleeping area. Seems like maybe the curtains were, too. Or maybe they were gray to match the walls. The closet doors had a subtle mahogany sheen. It was the only touch of color in the place and it made rooms feel dark and dead. That goes double for the lobby. It also has no windows. Or rather it has a wall of glass that looks out onto a paved area that is so deeply shaded by the hotel structure overhead that industrial lights are required during the day to make it possible to see. Just. Either way the effect is the same: the lobby's so dark and gloomy that when - on the third day of our stay - one of our party said "meet you in the lobby at 9:00" another said "what lobby?" You will likely not recognize the entrance, even if you stop and stare at it. And the rap music playing constantly will make it seem - to nearly anyone who can remember the seventies - to be a very alien place. The fellow who checked us in was a young man who was able to speak at about twice the normal clip of a New Yorker racing to catch a subway train. And did. No time was lost on pleasantries. But he got the job done. If only he had listened as fast as he talked, we would have had to repeat ourselves a little less. The elevator guardians spoke no English. But the concierge was very helpful in guiding us to a good buffet. Our rooms were deliciously quiet, squeaky clean, but not always in perfect repair. Ours reeked of deodorizer when we arrived. And when we came back from dinner at 8:30 PM someone was replacing our A/C filter. Seemed strange. The other person in our party was in a room in which the phone did not work, there was no coffee for the coffee maker hidden in the steel cabinetry, a desk light took five minutes to come on, and it seemed impossible to get a WiFi internet connection. One evening we ate at Simon's. Sitting by the windows that open onto the sixth floor pool area we enjoyed a leisurely dinner. The menu was short; but its offerings were extremely well executed. It features sushi. which was excellent, though the portions seemed small to me. The decadent chocolate cake was baked to order and served with superb french vanilla ice cream. Extremely tasty. We stayed at Palms Place because it was highly rated in triple A, and we could get rooms at $100 per night - less with Hotwire. We were just using it as a place to be picked up from on a tour of the Grand Canyon, and it was completely adequate. If you want to share hotels with patrons who drive Cadillac SUVs the color of unripe avocado flesh or Ferraris in the fire engine red it might possibly serve that purpose, too. But if you want a place with the slightest touch of warmth, most Comfort Inns could do better. It's a little remote from the strip which is where one finds the best architecture, lights, and decorations in Vegas. This does make it quiet, but it also makes it more difficult to immerse yourself it exactly the stuff that one might go to that town to experience. The next time I'm in Vegas, I think I might stay on the strip. This review refers to the property at 4321 W Flamingo Rd. Las Vegas, NV 89104.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveler00
Reviews.Content: Palms Place is connected to the Palms Resort and Casino via a very short covered/climate controlled walkway. This hotel is not located on the strip. This is great for some who like to be away from the hustle and bussle. The room was very spacious and well decorated. The master bedroom was huge with a very 'sexy' spa bathtub tucked away in the corner. The room included a full kitchen and washer/dryer which we never used. The housekeeping staff at this place were very efficient, timely and complete. The room was alway spotless. The check-in/check-out process was very quick with no waiting. I recommend this hotel for those who like a more relaxed environment without a casino right downstairs. Another highlight of the room was the outdoor balcony off the room. Very spacious and a rarity in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative if you don't want to hear cha-cha-cha Ching all the time”
Reviews.Author: Clemsongal42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding and the room is awesome. There are great places to eat in Palms Place and we liked not feeling like we were in Vegas the entire time yet being able to head over to Palms when we wanted. The skytube is kind of a long haul to keep doing multiple times throughout the day so if the majority of your party is staying at Palms I suggest sticking with them. The only negative, which is a pain for Palms all together is it is kind of far from most other hotels and nightspots on the strip. We started referring to the cocktail area in the Palms as the Lido deck because we never left the Palms properties and felt like we were on a cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “The suites are comfortable. Nice amenities. Good service.”
Reviews.Author: barkinglobster
Reviews.Content: really good stay for las vegas. specious suites clean. great staff and fairly private.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place”
Reviews.Author: fatoohpdx
Reviews.Content: beautiful ammenities and great rooms. Couple's massage was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “So Sad to have to leave this review.”
Reviews.Author: Roadstraveledfar
Reviews.Content: I am so sad to have to leave my first bad review. :( I will be honest with you.. I "Won" this room on Hot wire. I am a strictly business traveler for the most part but love the gamble of Hotwire and Priceline once in awhile. I had stayed here before and the rooms were ok, they tend to give you a Hotwire type room when you get one that way. ( By the elevator, view of parking lot, etc... ) but at least you actually get CHECKED INTO the room, unlike I did! I had work to do so I did not get to the hotel until 10:00pm to get checked in as dinner ran late. My co worker and I took all my luggage to the hotel with the intentions of taking it to my room, dropping it off and heading out for a drink. We got there and there was this longish line and we got to the back of it. There were these 4 men at the counter being waited on by a curly headed desk clerk and there was a women waiting on the others. There must have been some issue because the time it was taking was crazy! We looked at our watches and we had been in line for 45 minutes! The only line moving was the girls, but SLOWLY! We were talking so I did not mind the wait, then I realized it was 11:00! And still 5 people ahead of us. An HOUR to check in? Really? So I went to the desk and politely asked how much longer, and got an exasperated " WHEN I AM DONE!" Hum.. a little rude don't ya think? So we waited 5 more minutes and realized how crazy this was to be waiting this long. So we left. I had to buy a new room across town as I was exhausted by now and just wanted to sleep. Like I said, I go to Vegas 3 times a month for Business ( I'm in the Wine Biz ) and you can bet I will not be staying at PALM PLACE anytime soon! When I called "Cassandra" to get my money back she argued and said " It is not our fault that you did not SHOW UP! " Well sweet Casandra I DID show up and had someone with me to prove it. You can bet when I am in Vegas next Tues staying at Trump Condo's I will swing by to have a word with your manager. Maybe he can pull up the camera on that Tues and see what I was talking about! He will even see me leave the line and approach the desk oh so politely! You should reconsider a refund when it is only 113.00 to save yourself the bad press that I am certain to spread with my peers! Not everyone is cheap when they come to Vegas, I spend plenty in Nine and Ghost Bar.... Not anymore....

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay in Vegas Hip and Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: lionmaster
Reviews.Content: Love every minute here at Palms Place from the time of check-in during my 3 days weeekend stay. Had tons of fun mingle with the celebrities who I saw while hanging out at the pool, this place is so full of energy and great people and staff is so wonderful. The 1 bedroom suite is superb, nice comfy bed, awesome kitchen with all the amenities in place, the panorama strip view is just so priceless!!! This room easily costs over $500 elsewhere but at Palms Place you can rent it for mid $200 during the weekend which is by itself, an excellent deal. I love the spa and the jacuzzi room inside the hotel, and the room itself has a big hot tub right inside your bedroom as well! You get to relax and checkout the views and have some champagne or wine while relaxing as much time as you want, you can't ask more. The walk to the casino side is a short distance trip about 8 minutes. It's convenient to play some poker and head up to the Playboy club. They got a nice food court and Imax theater inside the Palm casino too so make sure to check those out. I will be back in a heart beat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, except for the gym fee.”
Reviews.Author: adtravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palms Place from 11/7-11/10 and I was pleasantly surprised. I was looking for a place that is off the strip but still has that "Vegas" feel to it. Upon checking in, the front desk personnel were very friendly and accomodating. I was given 2 drink vouchers for every night of my stay and valid at any Palms Bar. My room was amazing! I had a standard king size, I'm assuming all of the rooms came with the kitchenette. If you're a lone traveler (like I was) or even with a partner, their standard room is more than sufficient. An upgrade would only be advisable if you are travelling with more than 2 people and you guys want some privacy (It's Vegas after all). Having said that, the suite was clean and spacious, the bed was comfortable, and the full size refrigerator came in very handy when I picked up a bottle of wine and brought home some leftover. There were two thing I love about my room: I had an amazing view of the strip and the distant dessert and the incredible bathroom/shower/bathtub/heaven made of marble!!!! I would have brought that home with me if I could. Housekeeping was also very good, I had asked for extra towels and corksrew bottle opener and they brought it promptly. Like I said earlier I was looking for an accomodation off the strip so I was somehwat prepared to shell out a $10 cab fare one way evey time I went downtown. It's worth the peace and quiet at the end of the day though. They do have shuttle service, but I think it only runs once a day (I could be wrong). Palms place is connected to the Palms casino via air bridge so it was nice to be able to test my luck on the slot machines and just walk to my room. I signed up for a couple of spa treatments as well. I thought their spa and fitness center was sufficient. It was comfortable, clean, plush. The only negative thing about the Palms Place is the the $25 fee they charge when you use any of their spa facilities (pool, jacuzzi, steam sauna, fitness center). If you book a treatment (massage, facial, etc.) you don't have to pay; but if you just want to work out at the gym - you may do so with a fee. The next time I'm in Vegas, I will be staying here again. Needless to say I will be skipping a workour;). I recommend this hotel to everyone who likes a combination of nightouts and quiet relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “No customer service whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: LazyTrips
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend booking this resort.... very disrespectful front desk staff that doesn't seem to have the time to accomodate reasonable requests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Scott G
Reviews.Content: My son was playing in a youth hockey Tournament at Las Vegas Ice Center over President's Day Weekend...this Hotel is perfect. It is on Flamingo and the rink is up Flamingo to the West. We stayed four days in a one bedroom suite on the 24th Floorl. It is much more like a condo than a hotel room. It was quiet, clean and the staff is extremely friendly. We had to hit the ice rink early, very early for 3 days straight even having a 6:00 am game start time and we needed to be at the rink at 4:45 am. The Valet service was excellent and our truck was headed to the rink within 5 minutes from the time I gave the ticket to the valet. No one was asleep or missing in action and the security was great also as I felt that some Hotels in Las Vegas (especially those with a casino) have a lot of riff raff hanging around, especially in the early AM. Not once did I feel like my family was exposed to the toxic element that some of Las Vegas attracks. Our room had a great view on the 24th Floor and the kids loved it. The kitchen was very handy (including microwave, full refrigerator, and best thing yet, a Toaster!) even though we did order room service two or three nights as the food from the restaurant on site is excellent and not really overpriced considering that this is a very nice Hotel and we were kind of on vacation. The TV also had a DVD player and of course any movie you could possible want to see. As for the internet, the hotel supplied Wi-fi worked flawlessly. The hard wire RJ 45 system is no longer functional (even though the room purports to have it) so bring a USB Wi-fi card if your laptop or other computer device does not built in Wi-fi. Cell phone Wi-fi also worked though our phones use a regular provider. Palms Place does not have a casino which is a great things for kids...Let's be frank, 10 year olds should not be hanging around casinos but the casino of the Main Palms Hotel is easily accessible by simply walking upon a secure 2nd floor pathway. You an be in the casino in like five minutes.... Some people have complained that the elevators take a long time...not me. The elevators worked great even though we had some wind...of course, if you are trying to take an elevator at check out time, you assume your own risk in waiting or being late for some appointment!!!! So own up to it and be ahead of schedule when checking out...Check out was painless and took five seconds. Any negatives? Well, the second bathroom needed an evalauation for a water leak, something did not quite smell right but I could not locate the source...the Suite had a few light bulbs out but there is so much light from the huge windows that it was no big deal. If you do blow a fuse, there is a fuse box in the unit. There are also plenty of power plugs, something very handy for today's traveller who is always charging something, like a DS! The only Complaint if I had to stand on one is that the management should contrive some way to open the beautiful balcony doors...even if it is just a few inches to get some fresh air. Or devise a new door system such that some portion allows a guest to open a door window. Any room can be stifling without fresh air and I understand the liability and risk factor in allowing guests to access a balcony but there should be some way to come up with a solution. The air conditioner worked fine but it is just not the same as fresh air. All in all, I will stay there again and I will recommend that any large group with kids involved in sports and or sports teams stay here...assuming their kids have respect for other people's privacy and know how to behave... Our unit had a washer & dryer which was very handy as my son got sick during a game so we had to wash his jersey. The TVs were great for kids and even had the NHL Network! While we took care of ourselves, when we needed housekeeping, they were on it. The showers speak for themselves as the 3 shower faucets get even the dirtest little kid clean! Bottom line, great location, great services, great value, loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: RidingAlong
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on a 3 day business trip. I was probably not the typical guest for this modern hotel but the staff treated me and my family like high rollers. I wish i could name every person. Used the onsite day care for a couple hours one night. You could tell the staff had a long day w/ lots of kids but they were still friendly. This hotel is not super close to the strip so i wouldn't recommed if you want to be able to walk to the strip. My room was the quietest hotel room i have ever stayed in and nothing smelled like smoke. Rain shower was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Palms Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: surgteck05
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic weekend! I love this hotel :)...I took my husband here for his Birthday and he was more than pleased. I have read several negative ratings and was very unsure of my choice but once we arrived I realized I made a great choice. The staff was a bit snooty at the front counter but I didn't really mind as I was not there for them and only had to interact with them twice, once at check in and again when we checked out. The room was very clean and had a great view of the strip (room 31-318 studio suite). It did have a balcony but it was locked, which didn't bother me as I don't enjoy heights. The room was freshened up when we were out and it was very comfortable, although my husband thought the bed was a bit soft..I loved it! I will for sure be staying here again and would love to own a suite myself someday. The hotel is off the strip so you will need to take a taxi to the strip or they do have a shuttle 2x a day. We drove to LV so we used our own vehicle and it was perfect as valet pkg is free and the valet attendants are very pleasant and attentive. Thanks again to Sniqueaway.com for the great deal :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautful modern suites”
Reviews.Author: Anejo-y-Coca
Reviews.Content: If staying off strip isn't an issue, I can enthusiastically recommend the Palms Place. I expected nice accommodations, but I didn't expect the beautiful room with the perfect strip view that we received. The suite had a nicely stocked mini kitchen with a small refrigerator under the mini stocked bar. Should you prefer to make meals in your room, you have all the necessary tools, including a two burner stovetop. The king bed was comfortable, and both the sitting area and the bedroom area each had its own flat screen. The bathroom was spacious and the shower had a rain shower head in addition to the handheld spout. A large jetted tub, plenty large enough for two was located inside the shower. The modern décor extends to the hallway, including the walls and carpeting. I also want to comment on the soundproofing of the rooms. One of my biggest pet peeves when traveling is paper thin walls. That wasn't the case here. I called my friends who were staying in the room next door, and I didn't even hear the phone ringing. Pretty impressive! The only negative was the distance from the Palms. It was cool when we were going to Simon for dinner, but was a pain in the a$$ when we left to go to the Playboy Club - and it's a looooong stumble back at 3 a.m. Also, room service is pricey. Run through the sky-tube to the food court instead. And they have Coffee Bean too!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: WesParkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palms Place over Super Bowl weekend in a Studio Suite. Loved the modern design, and as stated in other reviews, it felt a world away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. There were a few issues - First, I moved the footstool/hassock part of the sofa and quickly discovered that housekeeping never moves furniture around when vacuuming... lots of dust and nasty bits on the floor, (french fries, paper, etc) we also had to call maintenance to replace a couple of lightbulbs and unclog the kitchen sink. Those items aside, it was a enjoyable stay. I loved the shower, but would of liked a but more water pressure. The walk to the casino wasn't too bad. In a city with hotels this large, you'll find that most have a long walk from the rooms, depending on where you are staying. The staff of both the hotel and casino were very pleasant, and I would (and most likely will) return again

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: dslotkis
Reviews.Content: While throoms here are very modern and attractive; there are serious difficulties in staying here. It is probably a mile and a half from the strip. This makes it a cab ride to see the real Vegas. Cabs in Vegas are very expensive. To get from Palms Place to the Palms Casino is also a hassel as it takes around 7 minutes to go thru their walkway. While the staff was friendly; they were not very competant. They didn't give me anything that was promised in my package. I had to make an extra 3 trips back and forth from the casino to get everything settled; as the casino cannot help you with any problems from the hotel. The Palms Casino looks quite old. It doesn't have the glitz of most of the Strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Martinatd1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place! I loved it. Only problem was the fees that they don't tell you about. Another thing is that the 1 bedroom suite was very dusty, and the balcony didn't open. Other than that the view from the room was beyond beautiful and the hotel was very stylish and cozy at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Small Vegas Property”
Reviews.Author: TJC22
Reviews.Content: A little off the main drag and smaller, but still a nice property? Room & bedding are nice. Only drawback - no coffee in room! Internet in room is not free!

Reviews.Title: “Used the spa at Palms Place”
Reviews.Author: kypat
Reviews.Content: Used the spa at The Palms in January. The personnel were very nice and helpful. I had a back massage and the therapist was very good. The spa itself, IMHO, is average. The steam room was too brightly lit and no eucalyptus. It was pretty small. The lounge chairs were very comfy though. I usually use Qua Spa at Caesars and this spa was not nearly as good.

Reviews.Title: “Palms Place”
Reviews.Author: ediiii
Reviews.Content: First of all, Palms Place is not a hotel, don't be surprised if you expect to stay in a fancy Vegas hotel like those on the strip. It is a condo, with a good hotel quality. Rooms are clean, full mini bar, plenty of room, beds are so conmfortable. For smokers, there is a balcony, but you cannot open it for security purposes. Unlike crazy Vegas hotels, this one is a good peaceful place if you wanna do a business and relax. A good spa, good massagers, I did not like Hamam maybe because I am used to Turkish ones:)

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappoining”
Reviews.Author: nicolecokinis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palms Place the weekend of January 15th, 2012. We stayed in a studio suite 15-309. Don't let them put you into this room if you have a choice. The hotel I must say is beautiful. The rooms are cozy, so cozy because of the rooms terrible lighting. Don't plan on reading in there unless it is during the day and you are sitting by the window so you can get the daylight to hit your pages. The main reason I say don't let them put you in room 15-309 is that when the wind is blowing it creates an annoying sound like a finger going around the ring of a glass. This noise is loud and never stops. Along with that noise, we could hear a dog barking and barking and barking 2 rooms down from us. The shower has a dual shower head: one rain shower head on the ceiling and a arm shower head on the wall. The arm shower head's metal shower cord was broken and the water sprayed all over the bathroom. When I say all over, that is an understatement! The water covered the entire bathroom, the floor and the walls and the mirror. The water went every where.Even the toilet paper roll got soaked. I had my clothes in the bathroom to change into, well soaked also! I could not wear that outfit. The bathroom mat was so wet that it did not dry in the 3 days that we were there. I have to say the bathroom is a decent size , . It has a television in it. It also has a lighted makeup mirror on the wall. That did not work. In the living room the outlet cover was laying on the floor by the main column light. i did not touch it, but the outlet that it was supposed to be on, worked some times and not other times. This resulted in the column light going on and off every so often. When it did not work the room became even darker. Ugh, There i s no hotel information book in the room. You really need one because the hotel is set up that if you want to go someplace you have to take an elevator to get there. It was hard to figure out what the hotel had to offer. I did go to the front desk at one point to ask to be moved to another room. I was told that that was not an option, I said I would gladly pay for an upgrade. That also was not an option that the hotel was sold out. I said then can we change rooms and be put at the Palms. They said that the could not do that. Isn't the Palms Place the 3rd tower to the Palms hotel? So why could they not move us someplace. Don't hotels have extra rooms even when they are sold out just for situations like mine? I am pretty sure they do. But, not a hundred percent true. When I went to the front desk to tell them of the barking dog, the annoying wind noise ect. I was offered a late check out. That was nice and all, but why stay longer than I already was? The kitchen which we did not use, does comes fully furnished with dishes, pots and pans etc. That is a plus, you don't find that option at The Planet Hollywood condos. The front door man was great, he had the door open for you before you could even get your hand out to open the door. He was always very cheerful. The food at Simons was good.We had breakfast. Room service was great. No complaints. Very fast service. I go to Las Vegas 3 times a year. I am not sure if I would stay here again. There is a shuttle that takes you to the strip 2 times a day. Not good, the Rio across the street has shuttles all day long. You may wait 20 minutes max there. My husband has wanted to stay at the Palms Place since it opened. We could have stayed at a Harrahs property for free with the our players club points but decided to pay to stay at the Palms Place. I think that is what was the most disappointing part of the whole trip. We had so many issues and then had to pay a pretty penny for those issues when we could have stayed at Caesars Palace or Planet Hollywood for free. If you want to gamble this tower does not have a casino so if you want to gamble you better put on some good walking shoes, because it is a decent walk. Just to let you know allow your self a few extra minutes to your walk for elevator use. In the sky tube there is only one elevator to the casino and depending on what time of the day it is you may find yourself waiting for the elevator. I don't know if I would give it another try to find out that the other rooms may or may not have the wind noise etc. I hope this helps, Niki Cokins

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: taylortrio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio suite on the 22nd floor. Great view of the Strip. The room was large and accommodating for 3 people. The room smelled like smoke when we checked in and didn't seem very clean and fresh. I was going to ask for a different room, but decided to just let it go. The bed was very comfortable. The lighting was terrible in the room, especially for reading. The bathroom was big. There was no hotel book in the room which made it difficult to know what the facility had to offer (spa, restaurants, pool, exercise, bars, clubs, etc.). My biggest disappointment, however, was the staff -- we found them to be very unfriendly. A female bartender in the lobby bar of the casino was extremely rude or had an attitude problem -- but then expected a tip and made no qualms about asking for it. We tip for good service and attitude is part of service. Treat your customers right and you will be rewarded. Simple as that. We spent time at some casinos on The Strip and had good experiences with bartenders and waiters there. I think the Palms needs to spend some time on customer relations training with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more.”
Reviews.Author: Sunlily6336
Reviews.Content: Wow, our room was magnificent. A very large clean room with a view of the strip. The room was complete with a kitchen so for those who would like to do their own cooking, this is an option. I would happily stay here again. The bar and restaurant inside the hotel is very welcoming and does great bar snacks. There is no shopping mall inside the Palms which is a blessing in some ways. The little shop inside the foyer has essentials, but I found the staff member in here not interesting in serving me. The Palms Casino which is attached to the hotel has entertainment for kids (cinemas, games rooms which are suitable for all children) and eateries suitable for the kids also. It is a family friendly casino.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel for the Beautiful People”
Reviews.Author: melliempa
Reviews.Content: We rented a one-bedroom suite and were not disappointed. We had a lovely room with a view of the strip, a fully-functional kitchen, and 1.5 baths. The furnishings were lovely and the gas fireplace was a great touch. There was ample room to sprawl out and feel "at home." The hotel trends to a younger crowd...not a huge deal for us, but you might see a lot more people who could be your kids.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING... SCABIES from this hotel in Dec 2011”
Reviews.Author: LuvsTravel2011
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Palms during the first weekend of December & I contracted scabies from the bedding. Absolutely disgusting & per my Doctor- comes from unwashed or improperly washed bedding at this hotel. AVOID at all costs or don't sleep in your bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful alternative to hotels on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: LolaWantsandGets
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I stayed here during a convention. We got a great deal on the room rates, so we were very pleased about that. This part of the Palms is non-smoking and non-gaming, and all the rooms are suites with kitchen and dining areas. I love it when hotels in Vegas are non-smoking and don't have casinos when you walk in. Pros: - really nice suite, tastefully decorated - large living area, with a sectional sofa - spacious bathroom, with a huge tub and shower - clean! most important. I don't have any major gripes about the Palms Place. All of the cons are minor: - the pillows are too soft, don't support your head and neck enough - the room service was great, but the quality of the food was not on par with the price - there was a balcony, but it was locked and you couldn't go onto it. Why even have it if you're not going to allow guests to use it? - free wi-fi would have been nice. the wi-fi starts at $14/day. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Noob.”
Reviews.Author: ATL_Corp_Trvlr
Reviews.Content: So bear in mind this was my first time to Las Vegas and it was for a WORK trip - NOT a party or friends fun trip. I'm also not a gambler, so my review is of the hotel ONLY, not Vegas in general. Check in was fairly painless. I arrived early and there were no rooms available for check in just yet, but it wasn't really check in time. She did give me room keys that would be validated in about an hour. Work crew went to the 24/7 cafe where we waited 15 minutes to be waited on and then 30 minutes later received our salads. Insert comment here about growing the lettuce?!?! Took ages to get the check til we finally walked up to the counter. My room was larger than an average hotel room. The TV was from the 80's, had roughly 30 channels, some of which were hotel related only. The picture was horrible! Forget HD or even cable. The shower head was also from the past - it was loud, unable to be adjusted and definitely uncomfortable, to say the least. Other amenities were decent. The internet access was interrupted frequently, especially in the meeting rooms. The food was passingly average daily. Breakfast breads were cold and stale, but the fruit was okay. The bathrooms in the meeting area were very dusty and not very clean. Also, I didn't know there was smoking in the casino, there isn't smoking anywhere else indoors I ever go, so it was a shock to the system and it took it's toll on the entire company that was there. Dinner at Herb's was good - order the meatloaf but at Nove, - PASS except to go up for the view.

Reviews.Title: “High Priced fo Average”
Reviews.Author: 5fromSeattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Consumer Electronics Show. Although much better than old, worn out Palms, the off-strip location average decor and high price left me wishing for more. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel good not great”
Reviews.Author: nathan822
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and while i enjoyed my stay i felt that every area could have been inproved as if management was lacking in the commitment to spending . The property is a few years old now and it seems they may be taking there eye off the details ..which accounts for everything Floors were cleaned but not often enough .I saw food particles lay there for a while Massage was great but expensive and music system was down I needed something from the pharmacy( felt ill) and concierge promptly directed me how to get there instead of perhaps offering someone to pick it up .Didnt seem to care Lunch only had a 40.00 buffet menu instead of ala carte. Had to eat off breakfast menu Store selection limited The room while striking is getting a little worn and i didnt like the idea of cloth headboards cleanliness wise)The casino was pretty dead and lacked electricity Okay now that i got that out of the way the bed was comfortable, the rooms and bathrooms spacious much less hectic than the big brand hotels and the staff was cordial especially in the restaurant. Food was good and there is a nice bar off the lobby The hotel pool area and general public areas are very nice and despite my criticisms i would recommend staying here if the price were right, though it is more convenient to be on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and experience!”
Reviews.Author: lisar23
Reviews.Content: Palms Place is a fantastic place to stay on a trip to Vegas. Whether you are here for business or pleasure this hotel rocks! The rooms are large and modern and only a short walk to the Palms Casino. The strip is a very inexpensive cab ride away. I highly recommend the Palms Place and will stay there on every trip to Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice NYE get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: imahulahottie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for NYE (30th-2nd) It was my first time in Vegas! I really liked the Hotel, the crowd was a younger mix (I am 27, hubby is 29) We didn't feel too old, or too young here. Our room was the basic room, really clean, although the shower was kind of lame, horrible water pressure....but I don't think most people who are coming to visit would care about that. There was a lot of fun stuff going on for NYE, and A LOT of people everywhere! Could have contributed to some noise through the walls a bit, but again, it's Vegas and NYE, so no biggie really. One night we thought we heard a bit of club music in our room, but was very faint. (we were on the 25th floor) We played black jack at Randy's table-LOVE HIM! Really nice guy. Cocktail waitresses at our black jack table both nights were hardly present >:( But everyone else from valet to concierge did their job great. We ate at Simon's Restaurant NYE night, I DEFINITELY recommend this! Awesome food and drinks, and great decor and atmosphere. Overall, I would stay here again, it's kind of a nice get a-way from all the craziness going down on the strip, with that said, the only negative thing I have to say is because it's off the strip, it was inconvenient to take a cab into the strip every day, costs approx. $15 each way. Thank you PALMS for a great NYE!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but loud”
Reviews.Author: politebat
Reviews.Content: stayed here dec 7-10 2011. First room was clean and well lit..and the hall was clean and quiet. staff was also really nice and helped with everything we asked. i only had two problems one...the lobby and elevator music was LOUD...im talking blaring. im 29 and my fiancee is 28...we are not old people...and we like our music loud, but this was crazy loud. it only stopped when we got off the elevator for our floor. im all for new music,but to have rihanna blasting at 10 am is not my idea of a good time. Second our last night their, some crazy coed got the room next to my soon to be wife...and was really really loud...screaming and slamming doors, talking about some guy she was trying to hook up with. At 3am we had to call security, and they came pretty fast and shut her party down, so i would say say make sure there is a wall not a door between the next room. other then that, we had a good time. its like 5 mins from the strip so you might need a car...its to far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Dark interiors”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggrandma50
Reviews.Content: We didn't have any problems with the elevators or personnel that others had mentioned. But going into the lobby the first time, you notice that all furnishings are dark colors. And this continued thru the hallways, and into the room. Everything is in shades of black, gray or brown. It was hard to find the light switches in the dark rooms, and then they only use very low wattage. Makes you wonder what they don't want you to see... Very contemporary furnishings. We were staying in a one bedroom suite on a higher floor. We had the hide-a-bed in the living room, and had a better view of the strip & sunrise than the view from the bedroom. We had dinner in Simon's, which was very good, but very pricey. Location is not on the strip, but pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “I feel home at Palms Place”
Reviews.Author: fabry73
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I can't understand why I still haven't reviewed Palms Place. Along with another couple of properties, it's at the top of my preferences and I stayed there at least 4 or 5 times. Immediately after opening it was largely overpriced (I still remember a first days 449$ nt regular rate 449$ in 1bdrm suite), now weekday rate is consistent with similar room in comparable hotel. As you probably know, it's not on the strip (a mile or so away) and it's a condo style hotel with no casino (although a short covered walkway brings you directly at Palms casino). Relax and no crowd it's a must here, but still it's a "hip" hotel so folks are often young and glamorous crowding lobby bar and pool restaurant in the night. I always stay in a 1 bdrm suite. Only once I stayed in a regular studio and was not disappointed. But in my opinion the real breaking amenity is the jacuzzi bath tub in the bedroom, perfectly adjacent to floor to ceiling windows. You can easily soak inside while sipping a glass of wine (very romantic if you are there with your loved one), enjoying bubbles and watching Las Vegas strip lights. Other than this, everything is in modern style. One of the most beautiful bathroom I've ever seen, featuring a shower so large a basket team could fit inside at the same time, a kitchenette with microwave, fridge and so on, two large HD plasma tv and a great strip view being your room on the right side (mountain side is not that bad, either). One bad point: on my last two visits balconies were closed. I asked about at the lobby, they said it was a liability reason. I really can't understand the sense of building so large balconies and keeping them closed. By the way, I can hardly believe hotel (or condo owner) could be liable if you fall down a balcony

Reviews.Title: “For the trouble that I went thru I will not stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chkzf44
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I looked at for my stay in Vegas from dec 12-18 and when Priceline gave me a price under $500 for the whole week I could not turn it down... Now that my stay is over I would have paid more for something better... First off I read another review the day before I was to check in and it talked about a $100 a day deposit which was not told to me when I booked. I called and talked to a manger that day and the rep was so rude but the manager agreed to only take half which was $300... When I checked in the rep said that she was only going to do $200 which was even better.... WRONG!!! The next morning they took $400 out of my account and then the next day they took $161 out of my account... The manager agreed to have the money put back into my account ASAP and fax the information to my bank... That was on dec14 today is the 19th and my bank have not received anything from them... I called them back and the rep took my information and stated that she would give the manager my information and have her call me back.... 8 hours later and still no call from the manager... For this reason I will never stay here again... The room was ok!!! The room needed cleaning because it was dust everywhere and rust in the shower. The bed and view of the strip was great. Next time I'm going to spend a little more for better service. There are two many reviews about the poor service at this hotel I would think by now that they get the point and change the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Super luxury, super deal”
Reviews.Author: anakale15
Reviews.Content: We booked this property thinking it was a good deal at $70+ a night, but did not expect the luxury and comfort that we had. We did have some difficulty with our room (electrical) nand the front desk didn't seem to care too much so I asked for a change of room which turned out to be fine. Jacuzzi tub, adjacent luxurious shower, separate vanity and separate WC: all enclosed in glass. One of the best places I have ever stayed, and great rate (but not the regfular rate).

Reviews.Title: “The Full Suite Hotel of the Palms Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ed F
Reviews.Content: These rooms are the suites of the Palms Resort. It's attached to the Palms, but has its own lobby, check-in, valet area, and its own tower. The biggest drawback of the Palms is the location, across the interstate and pretty far away from the strip. We stayed here in July 2011 to see Bob Dylan in the Palms Resort. The kitchen is fairly well appointed, but not as nice as some other suites in Las Vegas. Very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NeverHomeAnymore
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently, we stay on average at a hotel or rental house 70 times a year. We stayed for 3 days last month at the Palms Place. Upon check in we were told we had not already paid for the nights which I had and had to wait for him to figure it out. (staff was less then friendly and that was 100% of the employees we came in contact with in the hotel/condo part. When we got off the elevator on our floor the carpet not only needed to be stretched severly but it was sooooo stained it almost looked like they had a horrible accident there......We got to the room which is a studio privately owned condo that I guess they rent out?
