The room size and decor was cool, modern and young. Sadly it must have been several months since someone had been there. Tons of dust and dirt. There were dental picks on the bathroom floor and also I could see pee stains on the marble floor. Seriously anamazing layer of dust we had to wipe off the counters and all furniture. Filthy, in the top 2 worst I have stayed in cleanliness wise. The view is great but the large sliding doors that led to a great patio were locked and they said they did not have the owners keys:( The tv then stopped working, we had to have maintenance come, he came back and forth trying to ficx it then got into the closet where all my clothes and jewelery items are and starts shoving everything aside and unscrewing some panel which was then laid on my clothes. The only nice thing that we have to say about the food. We ate in the casual Simon restaurant for breakfast and it was delicious and the girls there friendly. The italian restaurant Nove was excellent, wonderful food and great view too. I will eat there again for sure. I will not stay at the Palms Place again nor will I recommend it. The fact that they bill it as luxury is silly. My house is much nicer. It was cheap and I understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to pay extra”
Reviews.Author: Clay T
Reviews.Content: 5 of us checked in we all receiving different room rates. I was told I had used 2 bottles of water before ever being in the room. They took off the bottle charge but couldn't explain the different room rates. There was a non-refundable $15 daily resort fee which went toward free parking and a free shuttle ride to the Strip (it operated only twice a day). There was a $100 per day "incidentials" hold on everyones credit card.(No it did not roll over it was cumlative). It was refunded at the end of stay, minus any charges incured. They also charged $15 a day to use the internet and $25 a day to use the exercise facilities. 3 of us received $20 drink coupons and 2 received $15 drink coupons. They said the reason was they were phasing out the $20 drink coupons. We turned the use of the drink coupons into a game of "guess how much it'll be now" because each time we ordered the SAME drinks at the bar the price always changed. One night 3 of us has 3 rounds and the price changed each time, $22, $24 & $25. Don't bother asking for an explaination, unless you want the the bar tender to become defensive. We all canceled our return to the Palm in two weeks.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pretentious”
Reviews.Author: lovetheblue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a great deal on a suite in May 2011. Check-in was simple and swift. We were thoroughly pleased with the amenities of the suite: a full kitchen, large bath & the most comfortable bed on which either of us had ever slept!! Access to the casino, spa & pool was easy. We ate at the Mexican restaurant, which was just so-so. The adjacent bar was casual, easy-going, and well-staffed. The pool was lovely! We lost track of time basking in the heat, and my husband fried himself quite well. The off-the-strip location was bittersweet; it was nice to be in the quiet, though there was a night we were too lazy to get a cab, so decided to just eat at N9ne, rather than elsewhere. If you want to just get out and walk around to get some air or people-watch, Palms inhibits that possibility. Speaking of N9ne: don't waste your money! The steaks are over-seasoned, over-priced, and lackluster at best. The meal was fine, but I want more than "fine" when I'm paying for "amazing". I had a better meal for half the price at Serendipity! The crowd (guests & staff) were a bit on the pretentious side: like they were hired to look pretty, but not much else. Our questions (though few) were answered, but not in a "we're here to help" sort of way; more of a "you're on my catwalk" manner. This hotel is definitely for the "pretty" ones: not ashamed to see or be seen in attire that is unnecessarily (albeit purposely) revealing. I gave Palms Place four stars because the price was right, the suite was big, and the bed was heavenly. (Those of you who don't sleep in Vegas will never know what you're missing!) However, I will stay on the strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “some changes but still a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: buffaloMT
Reviews.Content: We frequent Vegas all year round and have stayed with palms place a half dozen or so times. We upgraded to a suite for the first time this trip and it was awesome! 51st floor on the corner facing the strip. The room was large and perfect as we had our 10 year old son with us. The larger kitchen area is really nice. And tons of closet space! We hadn't stayed at this property for a year or so and defiantly noticed some changes. I have to agree with some other reviews that the resort fee charge seems a little high considering they not only still charge for internet but its a separate charge per device. We also noticed they seemed to have cut back on security, we noticed hardly any presence in the sky tube area. Previous stays we had noticed a greater security presence. The taxi/valet stand seemed to be empty most times forcing us to walk to the palms for a taxi. One thing which remained the same is the service at Simon. Great food but to say the service is slow is an understatement. Every time we have ate at this restaurant the servers seem to be in a different world, everything takes forever! And the place is usually empty! The simon staff should go take notes next door at N9NE! Overall compared to other recent stays around town I would return here first. Two of our favorite restaurants in town are next door (N9NE & NOVE). See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ymahmood
Reviews.Content: The hotel is immaculate, bedroom, bathroom, Shower, flat screen TVs, View, is ALL superb, only negative really is the walk from the tower I was on to the pool or casino. Otherwise a fantastic experience and pleasure to stay and would definitely stay again!! Clubs are free during the week for residents you have to pay on weekends. Pool party are free and are soo kool.

Reviews.Title: “Spoil yourself at the Palms!”
Reviews.Author: JenT808
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe our stay!! We want to thank the Palms Place staff for allowing us to have a vacation of a lifetime. We asked for an upgrade and believe me it was soooo worth it! We couldn't have imagined a more beautiful room! A 1 bedroom corner unit with a magnificent view of the entire strip!! Just gorgeous! The bed was so comfortable too! Love the pampering at the spa & enjoyed the continental breakfast the Simon's. Just a tremendous getaway! Mahalo Nui Loa (Thank you so much) Mal at the front desk and the entire staff of the Palm! Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “studio sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Mona718
Reviews.Content: their studio suite was very nice, they put us in a handicap acessible room and was changed the next day because we wanted a better shower and balcony. which we learned later was locked...hmmm.. but over all the room is nice. 3 tvs 1 in bathroom and two in the room. a full kitchen w utensils to save money on eating outsome times. no pool activites for us because we went during off season. the buffet in the casino isnt bad but not great. the clubs in the hotel are free for hotel guest umm we partied at other clubs most of the time(females look great and you might get stopped to get in for free) if you like piece and quiet stay here and aif you like partying and what not stay here and just walk over to the palms or take a cab to the strip(10+ bucks) the hotel staff is great out ihome didnt work they quickly came to replace it but it turned out to be the outlet hopefully they fixed it(i told her it wasnt necessary at the time) housekeeping is really good. the simon resturant in the hotel is very nice out the windows is the pool area, we were 1st in room 8 smh then room 39 8 had no good view but 39 was facing the strip! ..overall i would stay here forever!

Reviews.Title: “"Quite side of The Palms"”
Reviews.Author: Chewtoy33
Reviews.Content: This is the quieter side of The Palms, the junior suites are affordable and nice ammenities. 2 large flat screen TV's side by side in case you cannot decide what to watch. Flat screen in the bathroom also (of course) Huge glass shower with a "rainshower" shower head and regular shower head. A large jacuzzi bath too! Microwave, coffee maker , silverware dishes, barware great mini bar. Rojo lobby bar is nice and hip. (with to go cups) a short trip on the sky walk, elevator down and your in the casino. it is off Strip but nice rooms and short cab ride to the Strip. I highly recommend,

Reviews.Title: “The Negatives Outweigh the Positives”
Reviews.Author: wannabefrench
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 11/4-11/7 and were extremely disappointed. First of all, we booked the tan, liquor, spa package and found upon checking in that we still had to pay a $15 resort fee (EVERYONE does, which BTW is actually $16.80 with tax, and gets the liquor credit); the "tan" is two sessions (for our three night stay) of no more than 12 minutes each; and the spa is only open from 11-7, so you have to go when you are otherwise occupied doing something fun, like out on the strip. Oh and if you do want to take their shuttle to the strip, there are only two: 10am and 5pm, and there is no return shuttle for the 5pm drop off. There is basically nothing around The Palms, but it is peaceful if that's what you want. The room has a full kitchen, which you can actually cook in, but we were told not to store anything in the refrigerator as housekeeping may throw it out. There is a mini-bar, but don't touch anything as the sensors will charge your room for items you just pull out to look at. The pool closed down for the season the day we arrived, so eating at Simon's Restaurant, which everyone raved about, seemed pointless since there was nothing to look at from their windows but a bunch of pool equipment. Our main criticism though was the cleanliness of our room. On Saturday we called housekeeping three times throughout the day for towels and a few things, like cleaning the filthy floor, and then when no one showed up we called the front desk. Finally they sent someone up sometime while we were eating dinner. The next day we put up the "housekeeping service sign" first thing in the morning and when we returned to our room at 6pm it was still a mess. We found a maid down the hall cleaning another room and asked if she would be coming to ours - she said "no." "What?" we asked...and she said that they were told to only clean certain rooms on certain days. I called the front desk again and they said they were sorry, but the least they could have done was offer us some small incentive for our trouble - even Starbucks gives you a free drink coupon when they screw up. But this was more than that; this was insulting to find out that they purposely don't clean rooms, even if you request it that day. I have traveled all around the world and have never been treated this way. Additionally, I feel that the package and the pictures were a misrepresentation of reality. On the positive side, the suite was very roomy, with a full kitchen. It was quiet and relaxing, and the beds are great...hmm... I can't think of anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Insight for the business traveler staying at Palms Place”
Reviews.Author: ptbrk
Reviews.Content: A bit away from the strip and somewhat battered but large enough to throw a reception if you stay at a one bedroom suite. It's unfortunate that management isn't taking good care of the place and their service is just average. Their room lighting design is on the dim side and makes it difficult to read documents just about anywhere you are. Wireless service is better if you use the wired connection but decent if you use wireless. It comes at a price of 14.99 per day per device. The chair at the only desk they offer is too low for tall people and after an hour of typing on a laptop you upper back can feel the strain. The large counter at the kitchen is helpful for spreading documents but the lighting again isn't all that good. Valet is slow just like anywhere in Vegas' hotel. If you are lucky, you may find self parking across the valet area and it is just a quick walk to the front door. Otherwise, you may end up having to take the sky tube which is a very long walk. If you are there strictly for business, skip this one. It wasn't really meant to accommodate business people on duty.

Reviews.Title: “"It is necessary to think"”
Reviews.Author: InnPet
Reviews.Content: Two days ago we have come back from Las Vegas. Have stopped in hotel Palms Plase within 2 nights. We like rooms with kitchen. Usually we wake up late, and we have breakfast with pleasure in pajamas. The room in Palms at first has disturbed us. It was dark and light hardly shined details. But it is idea of the designer, so it seems to us. If older persons appear here, I am afraid that they will understand not at once, where switches for lamps settle down. How the shower works? They will decide that the dishwasher isn't present at all. They should spend much time for the decision on these riddles. It can seem amusing, but we here is absolute with other purpose. It has tired us, we have lost a lot of time. All the rest was in our taste: a paradise bed; kitchen - everything that you will wish, even ice in the refrigerator; convenient a jacuzzi. From remarks (though it, probable, superfluous): local soap was flavourless; the towel was fluffy, but with dark strips; the floor in a bathroom isn't wiped; the balcony is locked. I the big fan of strong coffee, but about a coffee maker four bags from coffee lay: 1 with caffeine and 3 without caffeine (it wasn't updated). The remarkable hotel but to come back in a room? Possibly, it is necessary to think. Bright light is always good mood. Las Vegas - same a holiday!

Reviews.Title: “We thought this place was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: newlydiate
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as a surprise for me & it was a fantastic surprise. We stayed here for 4 nights in June 2010. We were in a one bedroom suite on the 23rd floor. It's all open plan but you can separate the rooms with concealed sliding doors, The kitchen area had a fridge freezer, microwave, and a dishwasher, with a breakfast bar, living room had funky furniture and a fireplace, in the bedroom were fitted wardrobes, flat screen tv, the bed faced the patio doors with views of the Palms and "the strip" & the best thing for me was the bath tub IN THE BEDROOM ! We had 2 balconies, (but no furniture) bathroom was great with a huge walk in shower, double sinks and separate loo, we also discovered behind 2 other doors as you enter the room, another loo and a washing machine & dryer. We felt that the room was so great, that we kinda just wanted to stay in it ! The pool area is quite small, but you can use the pool at the Palms, although your not allowed to take your own bottled water in with you. I fancied a glass of rose wine one evening whilst getting ready to go out & the bar at Palms Place didn't have any, so my partner had to walk through the connecting tube to the Palms to get me a glass! We really enjoyed our room here & had just come from staying 4 nights at Red Rock In Summerlin & wished we had used those 4 nights to have a fantastic 8 nights at Palms Place.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be GREAT HOTEL now disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: MTMilo
Reviews.Content: I used to really enjoy Palms Place. Efficient and competent staff, nice rooms, secluded, etc. Now it doesn't live up to what is was. Upon checkin I had to call to have room cleaned. Just today housekeeping didn't get around to cleaning my room till 6:35pm. I called front desk and was on hold for 30mins off and on. Very poor and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Carusonian
Reviews.Content: I have to say, it is one of the most beautiful hotels I have stayed at. The spa is amazing. Some parts of it remind me of Budapest and their mineral baths. The room was stunning. We were on the 50th floor and had an amazing view of the Palms and Las Vegas strip. Unfortunately, we were not able to access the balcony and fresh air from our room. According to the desk clerk and one of the concierge, unless your a friend of the hotel manager or own one of the units, you can't access them. Apparently after some people were tossing things off the balconies, this caused the hotel to initiate this policy. It's sad everyone has to be punished for one persons mistake. There should be warnings to guests of the consiquences if this were to happen and also have cameras posted outside to catch those who violate this. For that reason and a few others, I don't know if I'll be coming back to this hotel. I feel they play favorites. Like I said there were some other reasons. Can't list them now, however they will be addressed. Other than some of the policies and personal disatisfactions, this is a great hotel. They have wonderful customer service and everything is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an anniversary”
Reviews.Author: amuabe01
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our room for $30 and it was so worth it

Reviews.Title: “What a Letdown”
Reviews.Author: edgewaterguy
Reviews.Content: Dirty windows, balcony doors that won't open, grungy kids in the elevators. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations!!”
Reviews.Author: ericbfld
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the studio suite and was amazed at the size of the rooms. The beds were very comfortable and we were blown away by the great accommodations. Very nice wait staff and personable bell men and front desk clerks. The distance to the strip was not bad at all. It will only put you back about $15 to get to the heart of the strip with tip. We enjoyed the casino lay out and choices of restaurants too. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Items stolen from our room!”
Reviews.Author: jjCatt
Reviews.Content: While staying at Palms Place Hotel this past week (10.19.2011-10.24.2011) we had items stolen from our room. We were shocked and disgusted to find clothing and food missing when we would return (on 2 separate occasions). The only other people that were in our room were housekeeping. I reported my things missing immediately. Hotel Security took a statement and will be contacting me after further investigation. No one at all from this hotel seems shocked or confused that this happened when I reported it multiple times. Also the Televisions/remotes barely work. Rooms are nice and spacious. Had a spectacular Shower/Bath. Very soft beds. Large smoke detector that flashes green light through the sleeping room can be a bit irritating. I would NOT stay here again. My advice to others: if you are staying in this hotel, make sure you don't bring anything of value and have a lock on your bags.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mellymacd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio suite at the Palms Place. What a great choice. Gorgeous living room area, comfortable beds, amazing bathroom and kitchenette. The front desk staff - the one that looks like a Kardashian - was friendly and accommodating. The Palms Place pool is very nice. The younger cousin of the pool at the Palms and a bit more low key. Expect partying to all hours...although you can hardly hear anything in the rooms. My only complaint is that the hallways are so dark...why? Balcony is locked, so if you are a smoker...you'll have to head to the Palms Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Em C
Reviews.Content: The room was amazing and we had a great view of the strip. However, the room was incredibly dusty and dirty. It seemed like the hotel cleaning staff would come in and change the sheets but do little else. The location is horrible because nothing is nearby and the building is so incredibly dark-probably to hide the fact that they don't ever clean. The staff was not very helpful or friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Again I must stress this isn't a hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: rjkazoo
Reviews.Content: This Palms Place isn't a hotel its a condo tower...my stay was extremely disappointing because we had booked for a cocktail party and the front desk and security gave us a hassle when our guests arrived. They said that even though we had both suites side by side which is misleading in itself...that we could only have 8 people in our room. Very confusing and not worth the hassle. The staff was less then helpful and I will NEVER again patronize either the Palms or Palms PLACE>>>I total fail and very embarrasing to my people. It was ghetto and had a very wierd vibe. The place was empty and the staff had nothing better to do then to harass the few rooms that were occupied. NEVER AGAIN...there are so so many better choices in LAS VEGAS

Reviews.Title: “RIPPED OFF & LATE FOR MY EVENT”
Reviews.Author: SUPERCOLOR
Reviews.Content: Want to check in on time? Don't go here. Check in is at 3, you might get your room at 5. But wait! If you're willing to pay $100 to upgrade they amazingly have a room right now! Horrible service, fleecing staff, air conditioning didn't work, paint peeling, called for extra pillows and they never showed up. Don't bother asking for a discount based on your awful experience, they have no time for you.

Reviews.Title: “Palms place 48 hour festival”
Reviews.Author: Why_Annie
Reviews.Content: Came to vegas for 48 hour music festival..thought palms place hotel would be far enough away and st ill nice....had to wait in lobby for my room..even though I requested rflat check in....missed 1st band waiting on maids. Check in had one person waiting on the masses..I do not see how this place can be rated top notch

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjve9876
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a bachelor party, while checking in we were able to upgrade to a very nice suit for 80% off the price! I've stated at this hotel many times and have enjoyed every time. There is never a line for a cab, you don't have to enter and exit through a confusing huge casino and that means you don't smell like smoke by the time you get to the room. The rooms are bigger than most rooms in vegas for the price and the staff is great. The room service is a little slow but overall they have provided me with outstanding service in comparison to all the other hotels in vegas I've tried.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: SpanishInstitute
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the hotel... small but comfortable and right next to the Palms Casino. The Free breakfast that was included was good.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: fourblackstone
Reviews.Content: I found the previous reviews to be pretty accurate. I'm just not a Vegas person but I had to be there for business so staying away from the strip was fine for me. I stayed for three nights using a Groupon which included a dining credit at Simon. First the good: The restaurant was excellent - in service, setting and food. I had dinner there three nights and enjoyed everything. The staff at PalmsPlace were all friendly as well. The spa was well-appointed. I upgraded to a one bedroom suite. It had a great view of the strip and tons of space - 1200 sf. I thought the style was great - very Vegas but not cheesy. Now the bad: Yes, the many other reviewers are right - the rooms are in a sad state of repair. Three out of four lights in the living room were out, the bathroom sink faucet came off in my hand, chipped paint and wall paneling everywhere, torn carpeting and dusty all over. In fairness the dark color scheme really accentuates all of the wear and tear. Think black cars. The bottom line: using a Groupon on a peak weekend (Columbus Day) I thought it was a good value. Otherwise, I would look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: Karjanmed
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Palms on business. Couple things: The check in could take you forever. I had my colleagues come in at different times and all of them had same issue. House keeping is sub par.The lobby has nothing going for it and the playboy club is running on its legacy fame rather than anything new. They are also missing on prime shows like the rest of the strip hotels. When my colleague and I complained about housekeeping, they were quick to acknowledge and transferred us to a superior condo but there again housekeeping was the problem. I think the issue with Palms is that they either have fewer staff on board or pay less. Either way you can see the effect flow down during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dark & Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: Found our room to be dirty from top to bottom. Shower knobs falling off, shower glass has not been cleaned in a while. There was some sort of alarm that would beep every minute, went on all night. The hotel desk said it was the dishwasher, funny thing was or room didn't have a dishwasher. Only one television had a good picture, the one in the bathroom but who wants to watch a movie in there?

Reviews.Title: “The Palms Place”
Reviews.Author: Vanc0uverd0ll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palms Place for 2 nights in Sept 2011. The room was amazing, the bathroom had a tv, rain shower and a bathtub. The room had a full kitchen and had a great view of the strip. The casino has a good choice of food and it doesnt stink like smoke as soon as you walk in like other hotels. The only things I didnt like was that it was pretty far from the strip (there is a shuttle across the street at the hotel) and the Palms Place is the furthest away from the casino so you have to walk quite aways to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms but rest just ok”
Reviews.Author: junkrus
Reviews.Content: From what I understand these are condos that people rent back through the hotel. I initially graded it 3 stars but after I read my review I felt obligated to kick it up to 4 stars. However, I must say I would give it 4 stars if you were going with your significant other as opposed to a bunch of guys like we did (see cons below). We bought a groupon that covered us for two nights so that is why we chose this place. We actually believed we were staying at Palms but that was our fault for not paying attention. Here is the Readers Digest on this place Pros: -We stayed in studio suite with kitchen so the room was very spacious with two giant tv's. The kitchen is pretty much useless for Las Vegas except it came in handy. We used the small fridge to stock pile water and stuff. -Big bathroom with nice rain shower and jacuzzi tub. (althought I thought it felt worn and the tile was a little dated for a newer place plus the knob on sink was broke) -The hotel was pretty empty, which was nice to be away from crowds for a little bit. -Parking lot was close to the front of hotel -Fitness center and spa area were very nice -Pretty quick response to maintenace issue with safety deposit box -The restaurant Simons was great! -Quick access to Palms casino and clubs -Bed was very comfortable Cons: -Hard to explain and probably doesn't make sense, but it just seemed like the room felt dated even though newer hotel. -How in Las Vegas can you not have rooms with two beds in it? We were told unless we upgraded to a penthouse suite for $1200-$2500/ night we couldn't get two beds. This was a deal breaker for next time. We would just stay at Palms at one of their suites or regular room with two beds. Like I said, if I was going with my wife I would saty here, but with a bunch of guys i would stay elsewhere. I am past that point in my life to share a bed with one of my friends! :)

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: Danie'l S
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here this past weekend. The room looked nice at 1st glance. But it really wasn't all that clean. Then we tried to sleep... there was some annoying dog yapping ALL night and the AC made an weird noise. So I called in the morning to request a different room. They didn't really seem surprised and didn't even over an apology. I decided to take a bath before going down to the pool since our new room wouldn't be ready for several hours. Well, the jets in the tub didn't work. Then we went to the pool - wasn't really all that great. We checked our bags then went out for a bit. When we came back about 3 or 4 we got our new keys and they said our luggage would be right up... well over an hour later our stuff STILL wasn't there. Really? What a joke. However we called down and eventually got our bags. The new room was much quieter and we did get some sleep so that was a plus. I just don't think we would stay here again, it wasn't great and the whole bathroom layout sucked. The towels are forever away from the bath tub and shower and its super slippery and not enough lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Palms Place Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lfreem
Reviews.Content: The room was decent. But the shower was terrible and the sink leaked. We went to the pool on the 6th floor and found it old and outdated. Decided not to even try and swim. The other pool was pretty nice. We had a free breakfast buffet and it was pretty good. Lots of choices to choice from.

Reviews.Title: “On balance...would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: elwitty
Reviews.Content: As most have said, this place has it's good and bad points. However, overall I think it is a great place to stay for those placing a premium on the party scene and I would stay here again. The rooms are very hip, the showers are amazing, the views of the strip are great, and the nightlife (along with Ditch Fridays at the Palms Pool) is amazing. I don't think the complaints about the walkway are well founded...it's not a long walk at all. The complaints about the elevators, however, are actually valid as we had a number of issues with them. The layout of the pool and spa are really great and I would love to return to these areas. The cabanas are reasonably priced ($150 for a Friday). As for the service, I thought it was really good. However, the hotel seems to have a very unclear (to put it mildly) policy on tipping. Although a 20% gratuity is automatically added to mostly everything (including cabanas, spa treatments, etc.) the bill they give you at the end does not mention the automatic inclusion, notes only the final cost, and leaves a blank for the gratuity (which basically invites you to double tip). As I thought 20% was sufficient, I did not add an additional gratuity and noticed that the staff seemed somewhat disappointed. It is a strange policy and really the only negative mark on what is otherwise a really great property with an awesome party scene. As for the resort fee, it is pretty commonplace but make sure to get the $20 drink credit and $30 spa credit, which makes up for it. The Palms Place is not for families or for those who want that whole classical luxury feel (like let's say Bellagio). However, if you want to party, are setting up a bachelor/bachelorette party, or want a spa day, you can't do much better than Palms Place.

Reviews.Title: “Going Downhill Big Time.....”
Reviews.Author: stilettokiller
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin….. Pros: Spacious one bedroom suite with living room, kitchen (with no pots or pans, so what’s the point), One and a half bathrooms, jet whirlpool in bedroom (amazing, best one I’ve ever used), and great views (floor to ceiling windows all around). The hotel was pretty empty, which was great, but then also makes me wonder, why? Valet guys were super nice and accommodating. Parking lot was very close to the front entrance which saved a lot of time. Most hotels in Vegas would take you 10 – 15 minutes to get to your car. Cons: No staff. I would call the concierge and no one would pick up the phone. I would call the front desk and it would ring at least 50 – 60 times before I would either hang up or someone would finally pick up. The concierge was extremely rude and wanted nothing to do with helping us find a club to go to. He was from England or something, just wanted to point that out, so that maybe the Palms will know who I am referring to. The room was very big and modern, BUT, the damage in the room was ridiculous. Holes in the walls, wallpaper peeling off, cereal and crumbs under the couch, speaker broken off of the t.v., handles broken in the main shower, t.v. reception sucked, no pots or pans in the kitchen which to me is NOT a state of the art kitchen, as they would describe on their website. Why offer a stove to your customers when you don’t provide pots or pans. Do they actually think people are travelling with these things….give me a break. The hotel was unstaffed, and rundown. I called for an extra blanket the first night and they told me they had run out……excuse me, like what do you even say to that. Ran out of blankets, but this is your business, providing your customers with comfort while they sleep….that was confusing. No one even apologized for it, they could have cared less. Here’s a little tip, Pamls, send one of your worker’s to go and buy a couple extra blankets at Walmart if you’re that in need, it’s really not that difficult. Another tip, if you’re going to charge people for damage, why don’t you try fixing it with the money you charged them, so the next customer doesn’t have to experience it. The elevators, well, let’s just say that was a chore….getting your key to actually work was comical. I couldn’t even believe how inefficient that was. Great idea, if it actually worked. And really, it’s for security, you have one elevator that you don’t even need a key for. It will allow you to travel to any floor you want. As for the security on the main floor asking patrons to see their room keys, what a joke, you’re just misleading your customers in actually believing their safe, when in all reality, someone can just take the skytube (2nd floor) over from the palms casino and jump right on an elevator free and clear….no questions asked. Extremely poor setup and completely inefficient. I also loved how they were telling people who had just arrived that their elevators were experiencing NO problems. What a bunch of liars, I had already been there a week and there was nothing BUT problems the whole week, and they were quite aware of it. The pool at the Palms Place was a complete JOKE. They have about 60 lawn chairs for people to sit on in total, however, they only have about 10 for free and if those 10 are already taken, it’s going to cost you. They don’t give those out for free…..yes, you read that right, they actually have the audacity to charge their own customers to sit down on a chair at the pool. I couldn’t even believe it, what’s next, are they going to start charging people to walk down the hall?….unbelievable. The only good thing about this place, was leaving. It’s 100% going down the tubes and I don’t give it much longer (maybe a couple years) before they close the doors or turn it into a 2 star stratosphere hotel. They are obviously coming into some hard times, at least I would hope so, considering how they treat their hotel and their customers. The “no staff” and “not fixing the damage in their hotel” was a complete eye opener as to how bad they must really be doing. All in all, if you get an amazing deal on a one or two bedroom suite, it might be worth it, because the rooms are so spacious, but that’s the only good thing about it.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a big "man cave" with really awful music but really great food and drinks”
Reviews.Author: goodrel8
Reviews.Content: Black tile, black grout, accents of gray and stainless. Not my style at all but some might like it. The music in the elevators and lounges is really, really bad. Might be just me, but heavy metal at breakfast isn't really my idea of a good choice. The elevators are slow, the service is very slow except for one bartender at Simon's who was really, really good. The food is great and the decor within Simon's is lovely. The drinks are interesting and well-made. Everywhere else the lighting is so bad you can't really see anything. For example, if you're trying to find your room, the hallways are so dark it is difficult to see the room numbers which are about 3 inches high. The bed was comfortable, the linens of good quality, and our room was clean other than a left-over funky smell on the couch. The room had a great balcony but it didn't open. When we asked about they told us it wasn't available that day. We still don't know what that meant. The resort fee of $15 doesn't cover the health club. That's an additional $30/day. When we asked the concierge what the fee DID cover, she had to call a supervisor to find out. They charge a $100/day security deposit fee, too. Doesn't compare to the Trump, which really warrants the 5-stars both of these hotels have.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Be Fooled By the Pictures and Promises”
Reviews.Author: jennifer m
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my Mom's 80th birthday trip based on the write up and pictures online. We arrived to find a skanky old hotel that was dark, smelly, and NOTHING like we were expecting:( The room we were given was dirty, the sofa stained, the grout in the tub bubbling off and moldy, the furniture chipped and worn. We immediately wanted to leave and had to argue with the assistant manager about her wanting to charge us for the first night when we had been there 10 minutes. We finally were able to call the manager later and get the charges removed. Ended up at the Bellagio and had a great Birthday weekend...thank goodness!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe how bad the service was!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiptonlkt
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Las Vegas hotels with excellent service and reasonable rates, but given the rate and distance from the strip, I couldn't believe how bad the service was. Even just trying to get a taxi, which in Vegas is a basic amenity, there was very seldom someone to assist you! We mostly had staff staring at us like we had two heads, like they had no idea what they could possibly do to assist us. Are you kidding?! I have had such excellent stays in similar suites at the Venetian and Pallazo which have been cheaper, better service, and better amenities!! Just don't be fooled by the website. You can do so much better on the Strip! Unless you are looking for the best experience of white trash in Vegas, don't stay at the Palm's place!

Reviews.Title: “.... HORRIBLE ELEVATORS!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: taylor b
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed here last week and the rooms were great, no complaint there. The elevators are horrible. You have to wait a minimum of 5 minutes to just get into the elevator (waited 15 minutes once) and then you have to insert your room key to get to your floor, but half the time your key will not register and the elevator will keep moving and it will miss your floor. THEN you have to go back down to the lobby before your key will register again. The room keys get demagnetized. I cannot tell you how many times I had to go to the lobby and get a new key. They wouldn't work in the elevator, then I would get to my room and would have to go ALL THE WAY BACK DOWN to get a new key... then WAIT again for the elevator. The hotel needs more staff. No Taxi's like to come all the way to the hotel, and would wait 20 minutes for a cab and would be the only person in the line. I LOVED my room, but would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful - "2 Bedroom Suite" is disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HotelJunkie81
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here twice in the past three months, I am not 100% sure I will be returning. Picking the Palms Place for my 30th birthday celebration was a carefully calculated decision and it was a success in some ways, but a major disappointment in one big way. With a group of 30+ people, I knew I wanted a hotel that was smaller and would be easy to have my friends nearby. The Palms Place was perfect for this. Everything from the lobby to the pool to the bar made it easy to meet up and run into friends throughout the course of the weekend. My friends loved the modern touches and the friendly pool staff. The problem was with our 2 bedroom suite which was really two different hotel rooms "connected." On-line, this suite is advertised as 1,800 square feet and cost us $700 per night. We thought it would be a perfect room to host my welcome cocktail party on Friday night and entertain guests. And while it worked, it was not what was advertised or made to believe what it was. It consists of a 1-Bedroom Suite and a Studio Suite with 2 closing doors leading to the main floor hallway. There are two different room numbers and does not give the feel that you are in a 2-Bedroom Suite. Our cocktail party never left the 1-Bedroom Suite, as being in the Studio Suite would have been a different party altogether. Additionally, had we have booked a 1-Bedroom Suite and a Studio Suite seperately, we would have saved $150 per night at time of booking. This did not make me a happy hotel guest. When we brought up our concerns to the front desk, the hotel representative was a tad bit argumentative and didn't seem too concerned with our complaint. She then confirmed that had we booked seperately, it would have been cheaper, but we "pay a premium" to have the rooms side-by-side. After explaining that we had brought in 30+ people to their hotel and felt slightly cheated, she apologized and said the best she could do was $50 off per night. Even if she had used the $50 per night to send up a basket of fruit for my guests or a couple bottles of bubbly, with a note apologizing, it would have gone a lot further. I guess this is the difference between Palms Place and the Mandarin Oriental or even Aria. If I received a good offer to stay in the 1-Bedroom Suite, I would consider. But otherwise, my second impression was slightly soured.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax during a crazy fun Las Vegas weekend”
Reviews.Author: writeholt
Reviews.Content: I went to the spa two days during our quick trip to Vegas. It was a prefect way to detox & recharge after some indulgent evenings of food & wine. The hotel offers suites that are spacious & modern. The value is amazing but you will have to cab it to the strip. Celebrities favor the hotel because it is high end but low key.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: famousamos77
Reviews.Content: Palms Place is a nice escape from the hustle and traffic of the strip. We stayed in a 1bedroom room suite and it was awesome. The rooms are spacious and feels like luxury! We were not able to access the balcony due to repairs, and we were not to thrilled about that. The other thing I did not like, was the EXPENSIVE room service food. My husband and I purchased 2 breakfast platters with a carafe of orange juice, and ended up paying $80.00. WTH! (Hence the reason for the 3 instead of 4 stars...Also the concierge provided us with incorrect info, stating that a show we wanted to see(Prince Tribute Show @Hooters) was sold out..BUT my husband forced me to go to the hotel and check for ourselves, and low and behold, not only was it NOT sold out, but was half empty!!!! Other than that our stay was great, and I would stay there again, as the rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “To far from Strip”
Reviews.Author: shortcakeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Having a magnificent, clean, spacious and modern Studio Suite was great. Fantastic view of the Strip through a window with balcony that couldnt be opened was disappointing. The Hotel is way to far from the strip and unless you are 30 and under then I dont recommend staying here. Casino was lifeless and boring. No waitress around at busy times and my overall feel for the place was flat. I am 41 and young at heart but still felt old and outdated compared to the crowd that were rolling up for events on the weekends. Having stayed at MGM and Cosmopolitan, I wouldnt return to Palms Place.

Reviews.Title: “What an AWESOME weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: LovinLifewithYou
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 bedroom Suite and couldnt have been happier! This room was gorgeous with the hardwood floors, granite everywhere, great kitchen and super comfy bed. Gotta love the shower and jacuzzi with the big fluffy robes! Myself and a friend went up just for a last minute weekend getaway and felt like Queens! The doorman was very nice and set up a limo ride for us to Ceasars palace where he had a buddy of his get us in on the VIP list where we were escorted right up on stage with B.O.B...talk about front seat concert tickets! Even the after party was great and when we arrived back at the hotel the doorman was waiting with bottles of water for us to recoop after the long night but made sure to tell us of the pool party starting upstairs as well! I would stay here again in a heartbeat...ran into a few celebs and had a very entertaining elevator ride with Andy Milinakus! If you are thinking of staying here...do it....so great!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Copas2008
Reviews.Content: One of the best Hotels in Vegas, the suites are huge and modern with a full kitchen. The palms place pool is small but you can use the Palms Casino pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - but declining quality”
Reviews.Author: gilp12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Palms Place 3 times, both in the studio and one bedroom suites. The first time here, about 3 years ago when the place was new, was an excellent experience. The furniture and layout were modern, trendy, and overall outstanding and impressive. This past time, staying in the same room, I noticed a noticable decline. The rooms are still very nice, but it seems that they've let the place get run down quite a bit. Certain things in the room - such as the DVD player - were broken, the room number on the wall was not attached, the kitchen was worn. Sigificantly, they now LOCK THE BALCONIES. The balconies were a key feature of this property and the management does not let you use them anymore. This was disappointing, to say the least. Also, the Palms hotel itself seems to be in a state of decline. Pros: Modern, spacious, no casino in the lobby, full kitchen, washer/dryer, great value for the size of room. Cons: Off the strip, wearing down, balconies locked, palms hotel in state of decline

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but not much else to brag about”
Reviews.Author: brian12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife over Memorial Day weekend. Or I guess I should say that we stayed for part of the weekend, because when we arrived they said they were overbooked and put us in a taxi to the Excalibur, a total dump. So things definitely started poorly. When we were finally able to check in the next day they gave us some comps (although I had to argue to get more) which helped lessen the inconvenience. The rooms are really nice -- spacious and modern. The restaurant and pool are are nice and calm for Vegas. There's not much going on here. All the action is next door at the Palms. The trip over to the Palms on the moving walkway really is not that bad. I saw a lot of complaints in the reviews but do not share their views. The Palms has seen better days and at this point is all about the Pauly D/MTV scene. The gambling scene is pretty week and the table games are limited. They're the only major hotel that doesn't have Let It Ride which was a disappointment because they advertised having it on their website. I was told they dropped it because it didn't make them enough money. We had a good time seeing Paul van Dyk at Rain. The restaurants are decent but there are less options than most Strip hotels. And of course you are far from the Strip. All in all, I got a good rate that made it a good value. But being bumped was disappointing and the Palms has lost some of its luster. I liked this place more when I was younger. If you can afford to pay a little more for a nice room, I'd recommend quite a few places on the Strip over this unless you are going for the MTV scene.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Concept Hotel, But Showing Some Age”
Reviews.Author: etherrea
Reviews.Content: For a building opened in 2008, I'm surprised I'd be mentioning the wear and tear this Condo Building (note that this building is built on Condo concept, not so much hotel) has begun exhibiting, maybe it was just our room. We stayed in Room 28-320, a corner unit suite on the 28th floor looking at the strip. Upon arriving at our building's entrance there really was no pomp and circumstance that you experience in a typical hotel, the lobby and check in desk are simple, fairly small and elegant. Check in concierge personnel are very friendly and extremely helpful. There is a longe/bar in the lobby as well. When we arrive on our floor, it's dark, quiet and modern. The hallway evidently needs some vacuuming (against a dark carpet you can see everything) and the windows in the elevator bay could use some windex. I did so much research on the hotel and viewing pictures that there was no tremendous surprise in opening the door (but a view of the strip sure makes it more special!). The notable short comings in the room were as follows: - The veneer facing on the cabinets/entertainment center lining the wall under the TVs was torn/chipped/peeled in some areas - The kitchen sink faucet was not caulked properly so it leaned and flopped around quite a bit - The battery to our safe died half way through our stay - The television reception was terribly sketchy, may have been digital and received alot of interference (on both TVs in living room), thus we never watched TV during our stay - The complimentary breakfast ended by 9 am (starts at 7), we were incorrectly told it ended at 10 am, but it essentially only served muffis, juice and coffee, so it was no big loss for us - I read this before, but still worth noting, though the rooms have balconies, they doors to them are locked thus inaccessible - Fair distance from the strip, depending on any traffic, you're going to spend $8-$12 on a cab ride to the Caesars/Bellagio/Gambling Bill's intersestion (about a 5-8 minute ride away) For what it lacked in maintenance though, it makes up for in ammeneties and service: - Aveda tioletries - Incredible bed! I couldn't imagine why people raved about the comfort of a bed until I slept in it. It's worth all lauding it gets - Quiet building, its a good reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the adjacent Palms Casino and the rest of the din on the Strip - SkyTube makes getting to the Palms Casino and clubs VERY convenient; there are moving walkways, keeps you out of the blistering sun and there is music playing everywhere. I don't think it was more than a 3 minute walk using the walkways - $20 per day beverage credit at the casino bars - Free access to Palms Place Pool (subdued/chill) or Palms Pool (party scene) for guests of any of the Palms towers - VIP card for all access to all Palms clubs given to you upon your first club visit - Some of the best clubs in Vegas, if for nothing else THE VIEWS!!! - Get a Palms Club card, gets you discounts to one of the most ample and cheapest buffets in Vegas (Bistro Buffet) - Palms definitely has the loosest slots in Vegas, I won $300 on the penny machines in one sitting. As a matter of fact, I never really lost any time I played the slots (even if I only won a few dollars) I'm really never one to complain about any place I visit because it's all about the visitor's perception, however, the items I mentioned as cons I think are worth noting to anyone that's considering staying here. Palms place is about a 20 minute ride from McCarran airport and will run you about $25 with tip. I'd say the main highlights are as follows: - Playboy Club is posh you should visit - Moon is upstairs from Playboy club and has some great terraces to view the strip (great music play as well) - Bistro Buffet is the way to go, no better deal and selection anywhere. Though we also ate at Little Buddha and Gardunos as well, and are worth hitting at least for the ambiance - Palms Casino has the best slots, hands down - Great place to potentially spot celebrities. We met Daniel Negreanu at one of the Palms Casino bars while he was in town for the Epic Poker event Last but not least, book your entire trip through JetBlue Getaways, our hotel stay and round trip flight cost less collectively than airfare alone and was the best deal going on the internet (not to mention you get JetBlue points for both your hotel stay and airfare). Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Palms Place is great!”
Reviews.Author: esims04
Reviews.Content: The Palms really did help us have a great couple's night out in Vegas. Our first experience with the front desk agent Tom was great. He was really helpful and friendly. We wanted to spend the night near our friends and they were staying at the Palms Place which is different from just the Palms hotel. For only 30 dollars more, we got a wonderful suite. It had a small kitchen, table, stocked and unstocked frigs; everything was extremely modern and had sleek designs. The bathroom had a tv in it, and a HUGE bath tub with jets! Our room had a tv for the bed and a tv right next to it for the living space. It was a great room for a great price. Housekeeping was not on top of giving us a new blow dryer when ours died in our room but it did not affect our stay! The Palms Place is not in the same building as the casino, but there is a "sky tube" that easily connects the two hotels.

Reviews.Title: “No one answers the phones here. Cancelled reservation.”
Reviews.Author: JSBarrone
Reviews.Content: Incredibly disappointing is the only way to put it. I had problems starting with trying to make my reservation online. You shouldn't be getting a 404 error page when you click a link to a package listed on the property's website. So I booked a standard non-package room and decided to call to ask about cabana rates and availability for my stay. I don't know about you but when I make a call to a place of business, midweek, between the hours of 12-3pm, I expect someone to answer the phone. FOUR calls where I was supposedly transferred to either the front desk or pool area. Each time, I let it ring 20-30 times (yes, I counted!). No one and I mean not even a recording to say they were busy, please hold, etc., EVER picked up the line. This is how they conduct business? I cancelled my reservation that day. I don't know about you but when I call a business and the phone just rings and rings with no message or live body answering, I assume they're out of business. The worst part is, I'm supposed to attend a reunion here next month. I can't get service on my single room. What sort of cluster do you think I'm anticipating on a GROUP reservation? If we weren't so close in timeframe, I would recommend pulling the group reservation and staying elsewhere. I don't know if the rooms are nice or not. I do know I expect a hotel to answer their phones to answer any questions I may have about my reservation and their amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like a Peon from check-in to check-out and then after”
Reviews.Author: Esrozen
Reviews.Content: I bought a Jetsetter deal to stay at the Palms Place for a couple of nights with a friend. When checking in the desk could not find my reservation and after looking for it for about a minute they gave up and started helping other guests as I stood there in disbelief. Normally I would have just walked out of the hotel and found a different one, however I had already pre-paid my stay. Even after grabbing the attention of a receptionist and showing them that I had pre-paid my stay they still did not do anything to help me find out what went wrong. My friend and I were standing in the middle of the lobby with our luggage looking like complete idiots while being ignored by the hotel staff. Finally, when I found another confirmation and went to the desk they found my reservation and I was given the keys to my room. During my stay I wanted to alert management about the unbelievably terrible treatment that I received but I was told once that the manager on duty was the woman that I was complaining about and another time that the manager would call me back...that never happened. While I was still at the hotel I called the operator and asked for the head of operations. He did not pick up the phone so I left a voicemail. I was not answered and a week later I left another one. I still have not been answered. There are a great number of hotels in Vegas. Choose another one to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good place off the strip”
Reviews.Author: BKB02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palms for business, going to a convention down the street at the Rio. The casino is very busy (and huge), but the rooms in the towers are very quiet. Other than the occasional person going down the hall, I never heard my neighbors in my room. Good bathroom, very comfortable bed. Keep in mind this is almost two miles from the strip. You can walk to the strip in about 20 mins, but it's very hot in summer (106 when I did it). Always a taxi available. Only issue is that I couldn't access the internet (they have both wired and wireless, for $15/day). I called their one-stop service number who transferred me to somewhere else that never picked up. I didn't push the issue though, so I'm sure it would have gotten straightened out during normal hours. Staff was generally very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “LivingSocial deal doesn't feel like a "deal" at all at the Palms Place...”
Reviews.Author: mental_escape
Reviews.Content: Like many of you, we got the deal for two nights at the Palm Place Hotel. The price seemed right and we had never stayed there before, so we were up for a new experience. ...a new "experience", it was. When we first arrived, we had no idea where to self park for the hotel. We finally found the self park lot and we walked into the casino with our bags. They tell us that we are in the other building and we can take the sky walk. The entrance for the sky walk felt like a back service entrance (dark, old) and It was a really long walk between buildings. They even had a couple of those "airport" moving walkways to help with the trek. We take the elevators up and the women inside were complaining to us how screwed up the elevators were. (ok, they used a much harsher language than "screwed up" but since it's a family show here...) They weren’t kidding. Every time called the elevators, we had to wait a very long time for one to arrive and every two elevators were controlled by different buttons so one had to press all of them to speed up their arrival. People would already be cursing every time we stepped into an elevator. Our first room smelled of cigarette smoke, which supposedly was a non-smoking room. We requested a different room. When the bellboy arrived with the new key, he commented on how much it smelled like smoke. We arrived in the new room and now this one had a very odd, pungent odor. We decided that it was late and we didn't want to move again so we endured...ugh. There was leftover trash in the trashcan (red bull can, food, paper) and a leftover coffee pod in the coffee maker. I took a shower and the room must have been in an angle as we found water all the way into the hall and reaching the door. This happened everything we took a shower. We had to use our towels to mop up the water each time. Wow, either bad bathroom design or the building is starting to tip. Breakfast in the Simon Restaurant took a really long time. Most of the patrons looked quite annoyed with the wait time. Food was quite good but the delay would definitely prevent me from coming back. The only saving grace about this place was the Alize restaurant. This was my second time back and they do not disappoint. Luckily, I can come to Alize without staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First time off the strip, won't do it again”
Reviews.Author: ali28970
Reviews.Content: This place is a condo property that is managed by the Palms, not to be mistaken for the Palms towers. Very nice and modern design, but it's... inconvenient. The Palms casino itself is a short hike away, which isn't a problem if you aren't dripping wet from the pool or carting around your suitcase. Away from the chaos of the strip, but I'd rather not be waiting around for, and sitting in a taxi to the main strip... which costs anywhere from 12-15 bucks each way. Get a rental and zip yourself around town if you stay here. Also, if you need the warning, the Palms is very spring-breaker-ish.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Trip”
Reviews.Author: bossyEastTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. It was 2 adjoining suites so there were doors between areas, but that was fine. The larger side had a remote control fireplace and excellent views. I really enjoyed having my morning coffee relaxing in the tub that's in the middle of the floor with floor to ceiling windows. The balconies were nice, also. Both bathrooms were exceptionally clean and nice, with a TV everywhere you looked! Kitchens were nice and fully stocked with utensils. The beds were so comfy I didn't want to get up! We stayed here to go to Drift Spa, which we LOVED!

Reviews.Title: “Very Well Designed”
Reviews.Author: Metropolitan89
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very well designed and the property has a modern / hip feel about it. The swimming pool is a bit small and it closes early. I stayed in a room facing 'The Strip'. Awsome View. Hightly Recommend if you can stay there for under $175.

Reviews.Title: “amazing accommodation sheer luxury”
Reviews.Author: AndreaCockermouth_UK
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights in a studio apartment with continental breakfast provided. The place is amazing. the bathroom was spacious and sheer luxury. The view from the window was panoramic of the vegas strip. The bed was comfortable with lovely plushy expensive pillows. We could have self catered as all equipment was provided but we ate in restaurants. The fitness suite and spa was part of our package and both were excellent. I would recommend this hotel highly. It was not situated on the strip and the strip was not comfortable walking distance from it but the gold coast place over the road run a free shuttle bus onto the strip and we were allowed to use it. Just a warning we were charged a daily resort tax which we had overlooked so just to be aware of that .

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, hip and sexy...and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: Julie_N_Dave_C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (late 40’s, early 50’s) just returned from a fantastic four-night stay at the PalmsPlace Hotel and Spa. This was our third trip to Las Vegas. Ten years ago, I stayed in a suite in the Palms tower just after it first opened. We booked the travel package through Travelocity and got an unbelievably low price for four nights in a “deluxe” (read: standard) room in the original Palms tower. When we arrived, we asked the front desk clerk if we could upgrade to a studio suite in the newer PalmsPlace tower. Even with the upgrade, the room charge was only $100 per night plus tax…for a contemporary suite on the 51st floor with a spectacular view of the Las Vegas skyline! Overall, our experience was influenced by two main factors: (1) We stayed during the week. By doing so, we received a much lower rate and our pick of rooms. Even though we arrived on a holiday (Monday, July 4th), the resort was not crowded. It wasn’t dead either -- just the right level of people and activity for us. We would not have enjoyed this stay as much if it was overrun with people and more expensive, as can occur on the weekends. (2) The ambience of the PalmsPlace matched what we were looking for: contemporary, hip and sexy. The whole place exudes this feel, from the architecture, art and room design, to the music, the pool area and Simon’s Restaurant, to the casino and fabulous nightclubs. If that is the vibe you are looking for, you’ll love it here. On the other hand, if you are looking for staid classical elegance, this is not the right fit. And while we saw some families here, this place is not designed for kids. Before booking this hotel, we read hundreds of reviews on TripAdvisor. The reviews of this resort told us what to look out for and helped us avoid some of the problems experienced by others. Pros- The Studio Suite: The main webpage of the PalmsPlace has a photo of the suite we stayed in, showing the same view. Go to www.palms.com, and then choose the PalmsPlace link at the very top of the page. The skyline view is even better when you’re sitting on the sectional sofa near the windows. Not shown in the picture are the all-stainless-steel kitchenette and the spacious bathroom with floor-to-ceiling marble tiles, contemporary glass shower and hot tub. The bathroom is amazing. Outside of a few minor flaws mentioned below, the room was spacious, well designed and clean. Another plus is that the PalmsPlace tower is non-smoking, and the ventilation and A/C system worked well. The PalmsPlace Pool and Simon’s Lounge/Restaurant: The pool area looks like the pictures on the website – perhaps even nicer in person. Free towels are provided and there is a poolside bar. Drinks by the pool are a bit pricey, but not ridiculously so ($6 for a beer, $10 for a glass of wine.) The whole experience was very relaxing. Unlike the other Palms pool, which has a louder party scene, the PalmsPlace pool is quieter, more laid back – and very sexy. We highly recommend Happy Hour at Simon’s, where all drinks and appetizers are only $6. It’s adjacent to the pool, and the ambience is great. Ghostbar, Moon and Playboy Club: These clubs are worth experiencing, even if only for the views. The Ghostbar, located on top of the original Palms tower, has a near panoramic view of Las Vegas. We were there on July 4th to watch the fireworks. Believe it or not, the fireworks displays were dwarfed by the normal lights coming from the strip! Moon also has nice views, but is primarily a loud dance club frequented by 20-something singles. To bolster the upper end of the age demographic, we got out there and danced too! Playboy Club is best suited for those who like table games, where the dealers are gorgeous Playboy Bunnies. Life is tough! To get into these clubs at low or no cost and skip the lines, make sure you ask for VIP passes when you check in or get onto Chris Hornack’s guest list www.freevegasclubpasses.com We found his service to be great – just send him a text. It’s free. The Palms Casino: When we weren’t eating, lounging by the pool or hitting the nightclubs, we were playing the slot machines in the Palms Casino (and the Gold Coast, which is directly across the street). As advertised, both had friendly slots and are frequented by locals. The waitresses on the Palms Casino floor provided excellent service in bringing us free drinks while we played. It also didn’t hurt that every one of them was drop-dead gorgeous! We tipped them $1 per drink. Unlike the Palms, the Gold Coast is decidedly non-sexy – it caters more to retirees. But we enjoyed the slot play there as well and earned two free buffet dinners. Package Extras: On check-in, we received vouchers for two free breakfast buffets at the Palms Casino, four $20 per day drink credits at the casino bars, a free bottle of liquor, two VIP passes for free entry to the nightclubs, and free entry passes to the fitness center. Cons- Real and Perceived Resort Fees: Along with the room charge, the PalmsPlace resort charges a $15/night resort fee ($16.80 including tax). We knew this going in – so it wasn’t a surprise. Many resorts in Las Vegas are now charging this extra fee; apparently the Palms started charging it a few months ago. In light of the low room rate and fabulous amenities we received, we didn’t mind too much. However, if you wish to use the fitness center, it is located inside the spa, and access is not automatically included in the resort fee! We avoided this problem by asking the front desk clerk on check-in; he gave us free passes to the fitness center. Room wear and tear (minor): Some of the wood veneer furniture was chipped in a few spots, exposing the particle board underneath. Also, the paint along the edges of the dark brown door was chipped from people banging their luggage against it. A bit of cosmetic patchwork by the PalmsPlace maintenance staff would go a long way to fix these problems and return the room to top condition. Hallway area: The décor in the hallways is dark brown. While we liked it and thought it was sexy, the dark color scheme had a way of exposing dust along the baseboards and edges of the rugs. The hallways would look better if someone went through with a vacuum cleaner crevice tool and some touch up paint. (Unlike the hallways, our room was not dark and was nicely cleaned.) Table service in nightclubs: Another unfortunate trend in Las Vegas is that you have to pay exorbitant prices to find a place to sit at nightclubs. Again, we knew this going in, primarily because of Chris Hornack’s informative website. Rather than pay for table service, we just found a good railing to set our drinks on – and enjoyed the spectacular views! SkyTube: Some of the reviews we read complained of the walk between the Palms Casino area and the PalmsPlace tower. We did not find this to be a problem at all and enjoyed the short 2-3 minute walk. It’s a nice transition from the noisier casino. Even the SkyTube’s ambience is sexy! Off strip location: While some others complained about this, there are several options to get to the strip: (1) take the free shuttle bus from the Gold Coast to Bills, which is mid strip, (2) take the 202 city bus, which runs along west Flamingo Blvd. The bus stop is right in front of the main entrance to the Palms casino, (3) take a short cab ride costing about $8-10, or (4) Walk, if you are really adventurous, not wearing heels and it is daylight. It’s about ¾ mile to the strip, but you have to cross a very busy interchange with I-15; possible, but not recommended. We had such a good time in and around the Palms, we never made it to the strip. (We had been to the strip on prior trips.) Tips for enjoying your stay- --Stay during the week, if possible, to get the best deals --Book a basic room, and then ask for an upgrade after you get there (unless it’s a busy time period). You can get a great upgrade at little or no cost at the last minute when the hotel is not fully booked. You have more flexibility if you book directly with the hotel. --When you check in, hand the desk clerk a $20 bill folded up underneath your credit card. He/she will be more inclined to get you the best deals on room upgrades, VIP and fitness center passes, etc. Then don’t be afraid to ask for what you want! --Speaking of cards, use a credit card, not a debit card, when you check in. The Palms automatically holds a $100 per night security deposit on your card. If you use a debit card, you funds will be tied up for days afterward. (We learned this the hard way while staying at a Washington, DC hotel.) Also, tell the desk clerk that you won’t use the minibar, and he/she may knock that security deposit down by half. --Speaking of the minibar, don’t touch it or move the items around, unless you want to be charged. The items sit on a pressure sensor, which automatically adds charges to your bill when you touch them. We avoided this problem by not going into the minibar at all. Our studio suite had a separate refrigerator which we used for food and drink items. Don’t use the minibar fridge for that purpose! --You can keep dining costs down by buying some groceries. There’s a grocery store about a half mile or so west on W. Flamingo and a convenience store closer than that, within walking distance. There’s a Starbucks and some fast food places nearby as well. The 202 bus can take you to the grocery store. --Be sure you get on guest lists for free or low cost entry and line skip passes to the nightclubs. Otherwise, you may have huge cover charges and have to wait in long lines. Chris Hornack will set you up at no cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for guys trip to Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: smu09
Reviews.Content: Me and 5 friends decided to book a room at the Palms Place for Memorial Day Weekend. We got a 2 bedroom suite for around $500/night. The room was huge and amazing. 2 very large and comfortable queen beds, 2 large couches that were supposedly pull-out queens, but we never got around to it. What can I say....it was Vegas, and everyone simply passed out where there was space available. We got an excellent high floor room with stunning views of the strip. The white marble bathrooms were excellent; with good water pressure and temperature, and good Aveda toiletries. The refrigerator with freezer, ice-maker, and glasses was great for keeping all our beer and liquor cold, and basically providing us with a wet bar. We made drinks in the room before going out each night, and it saved us a lot of $$. I recommend stopping at a liquor store on the way to your hotel, and putting whatever you buy in your luggage (not sure of hotel policy on bringing in booze). The televisions all had HD ESPN, which was about all we really needed to kill time in the afternoon. Only weird thing was the placement of the tub in the middle of the room next to a window. Might be nice if this was a condo you owned as they intended, but awkward and unnecessary for a guys trip. The service at the hotel was a little lacking, and they tended to nickel and dime you. I was charged for a toothbrush(!!!!), and they tried to charge me for a disposable razor and a tiny can of crappy shaving cream. Didn't really appreciate that. The location off the strip really wasn't too bad.....it's already hot in Vegas, and we weren't planning on doing any walking, regardless of where we stayed. Cabs are cheap and plentiful. Worst part about the hotel is the elevators. They take incredibly long to call, and even longer to get to the bottom floor. It became almost comical, as they stopped basically every floor. We went to the pool all day one day, and had an awesome time. The crowd was pretty entertaining, lots of Ed Hardy types making fools of themselves. All my friends eventually found plenty of flirty, cute girls to talk to. Drinks were about $11, which was expensive, but not outrageous by Vegas standards. D.J. playing the pool party was pretty good as well. Getting chairs is near impossible, but we found a group that allowed us to stash our stuff under their lounge chairs. Overall, we had a good experience at the Palms Place. Excellent room and a really good value; service could use improvement but it wasn't a dealbreaker.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: lancearmstrong
Reviews.Content: awesome hotel. awesome staff. Booked a corner suite with a room attached, it was 3,000 sq feet!! 3 balconies, 2 mountain view, 1 city view. The pool at palms place is relaxing, for more action we went to palms pool, short walk on moving sidewalk. The staff helped us load a luggage cart full if beer, and gave me 20 room keys and a low internet rate I was quoted awhile back. Bathrooms and showers are simply awesome. We saw 5 celebrities including Jessica Simpson in the elevator, and Robin Leach outside waiting for a limo, Guy Fiore at the pool and also some Rock of Love girls hanging out. Best hotel I have ever been to. We were there for five days and didn't go to the strip once, no need. Brunch was very expensive and not worth it, only real negative.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: svdrumheller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May 2011. The Palms Place was amazing. The room was very spacious with a great view of the strip. The bed was super comfy! We loved that Palms Place was connected to the Palms! We were able to enjoy the craziness at the Palms and then go back to a plush suite to relax. It was not a bad walk! The moving sky tube was great! The pool area was nice and relaxing..but you can also go to the Palms Pool which was awesome too! We were there for the first Ditch Friday party and absolutely loved it! Great music and lots of eye candy! LOL We would definitely stay at Palms Place again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, a little off strip”
Reviews.Author: rayandgabby
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I travelled here with another couple this weekend. We checked in around midnight so only about a 5 minute wait checking in. Not too bad. We were both very happy with our room. Very clean, spacious, nice bed, 2 flat screens, a jacuzzi tub, kitchen, mini bar (not just alcohol), and a great view. Almost perfect. There was one issue. The remote control for the TV was not working, but for us this was not a problem at all. We weren't looking to spend time watching TV anyway. Oh and one more thing. I did notice our coffee cups were left around the room after it was cleaned. No big deal really. There were new ones in our cabinet. For those that do not know, there are several clubs/lounges in the Palms hotel which is adjoined by a tunnel/walkway so you can get right over to the casino and all the clubs/lounges no problem. If you do want to get to the strip the cab is about 12 or 13 bucks each way. Not a big deal, but i guess if you want your room to be on the strip, this is not necessarily the place for you. We ate at the restaurant Simon which was pretty good. Just had the sushi for lunch. Not terribly overpriced. Also had the lunch buffet which was only 14 or 15 bucks if you sign up for their players club program so a very good deal. Also, we did not have any issues checking out. Only valid charges appeared on our bill so no complaints there. Overall i would definately recommend this place if you are able to get a good deal. We booked through Living Social and received a good rate and a bunch of extras thrown in so we were all very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: AliasTT
Reviews.Content: I will NEVER patronize Palms Place ever again. I was charged two times (mistakenly) for one night, of which the customer service person told me it was because they were switching to a new computer system. Not only that, but they tacked on an additional $20 "resort fee" that was not added numerically onto the total of the confirmation. This disclosure was only in words, so you get a surprise bill on your credit card. It is not so much the $20 that is the problem, but the way Palms Place conducts its business that is very disturbing. If you are going to charge a resort fee, have it numerically shown on the bill, not disclose it only in words and have the audacity to say it's not a "hidden" charge, when it can clearly be misinterpreted as already included in the bill. I don't care how nice the rooms are, from this experience, I will NEVER stay at Palms Place when these two mistakes occur, and the resort fee was not openly disclosed. I understand the computer mischarge, albeit I think it was incredulous how I had to call them to get this charge reversed rather than them doing this automatically since it was THEIR FAULT. I hope they revise their policies soon and realize that they just lost a lot of business, making very costly mistakes and being extremely unprofessional. I have stayed at over 10 hotels in Las Vegas, and never have I experienced anything like this where I feel insecure about how much I am going to be charged on my credit card. Room at the Palms Place at your own risk, ESPECIALLY your monetary risk. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont want any customer service AT ALL! Stay here, plus they hold all the bill and deposit on your card!”
Reviews.Author: keriUk
