Reviews.Content: This was a return trip to the Palm. I was staying alone and opted for the Palms Place as I had been there before and knew I would be safe on my own. Howeer I had forgotten how awful the service was and unfortunately in the year since I was there it is even worse. When I arrived at the desk to check in the lady behind asked for a credit card. Assuming it was just to swipe to hold a number in case of damages I gave her my credit card. No conversation at all and then she announces, sorry this card wont authorise the $794 Im putting through...Errr Im sorry why are you trying to charge me $794 Ive just arrived I ve not even stayed yet and my total bill is $494 for the stay. Seeming annoyed by my perfectly reasonable question she replies, Oh we charge you now and hold $100 for every night of your stay for any room service etc you may use. I tell her Im not planning to and I would rather just pay for the room for now and pay cash if I use anything else I cannot afford to have an extra $300 held on my card I had not budget for. She does not care and tells me thats the deal. So basically I go with it she assures me when I check out the actual amount I have spent will come off the card and the rest will be relised in 24 hours to my account. So now I have left the Palms and am on to my next destination, its been 4 days since I checked out. Ive checked my bank anbd they have taken only the money for the room, all good then the rest of my money must be back in my account no worrries on with the holiday!! Oh no how wrong...I run out of cash and go to a cash machine to be told I have no available funds!! Uh oh what now I call my bank to say my balance says £445 but why wont they give me any cash, they take a look....Palms Place are holding $794 on your card madam!! What so not only have they taken the $400 plus dollars from my stay through a additional transaction. They have also not relised my original $700 PLUS payment. So now I am on holiday with no money and have had to make around £25 of calls from my mobile to my bank. Still trying to resolve the issue with them now to release my money as apparently no one there can help right now. This is a total disaster and is now ruining my holiday! They are rubbish, not only is this bad enough but I am still waiting for a $15 refund from them for the awful Wifi service they charged me for that does not even work. I will NEVER stay at Palms again. If you dont want any service level at all then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price and our needs”
Reviews.Author: momsnyre
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-bedroom suite, that was really more like two adjoining rooms. This was perfect as the two teenage boys got a room and we had our own space. Our room/half was a full suite in and of itself. The decor is very modern and neat. Working fireplace. Full kitchen. Stackable washer and dryer (which we definitely used, even though it was only 3 nights). Amazing views. Both rooms/halves had balconies. Great value. Quick cab ride or medium walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: mylissa26
Reviews.Content: First of all this property is absolutely gorgeous. We loved our stay in the comfortable suite. It had a small kitchen and an unexpected beautiful balcony view. The negatives were these: The hotel charged/held $500 from out personal checking due to using a debit card. I have used debit cards for 10 years to stay in numerous places and never heard of this type of policy. It's sad too. Vegas could have made more money off of us if the hotel had not held our money hostage. Also, you are charged a resort fee and don't receive anything for it. Everything, but the use of the pool is extra. $150 for the pool cabanas a day and a charge to even enter their much talked about hammam/spa. What a rip off! Again nice property, but overpriced extras made us feel unwelcome.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky and fun”
Reviews.Author: pepperzoe
Reviews.Content: Booked the room through Jetsetter in March, stayed mid-May. We were given a room on the 34th floor with view of the mountains. The room looked just like the photos, it was quiet and everything worked fine. All the employees we encountered were super nice. The pool was too crowed to swim on the weekend but was empty by Monday. Used the spa during the week, it was also empty. Enjoyed breakfast at the restaurant twice. Overall we had a great time. The package I booked said it included freebies which were at a greater value than the ones I received at check-in. I was so happy to be in Vegas that I didn't make a fuss. Then at check out we had a resort fee that I did not see mentioned anywhere when I booked. The desk clerk said it wasn't new and the fee paid for the coupons I received at check-in. Most hotels have resort fees now but I do think this fee was added after I booked. If you go make sure you get the room and extras you booked before checking in as the front desk seems to be on auto-pilot.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, limited service, location poor”
Reviews.Author: bfhk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The hotel is off the strip and what our taxi driver described as a "good area to get a massage" so the location is definitely not ideal. The staff at check in were incredibly slow but adequate. The best thing about this hotels are the rooms, which although look a little bit dated are very spacious and comfortable. We had issues with our shower while there and when reported to the front desk they didn't really do anything about it. Also tried to book a grand canyon tour with the concierge but was told it was booked out, we later popped into the Venetian and booked through their desk! Very limited services really. The pool closed early (6pm from memory) but when open was very good. Overall I would say you are better to stay on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good choice but...”
Reviews.Author: ekkwong
Reviews.Content: 5 nights from May 15 - 20th in a studio suite on the 53rd floor with strip view. We stayed in the Palms Place back in 2008 when it first opened and had really enjoyed our stay. Decided to return this time because we were travelling with our 4 yr old son and needed a suite with a kitchenette. Our overall experience this time is positive and the level of customer service live up to a 4-diamond property; from front desk, maid service to the pool staffs. The property, however, especially the rooms are showing some wear-&-tear; such as missing tiles on the floor moulding, silicon caulking molded/missing in both the shower & bathtub, stains on carpet, etc... I was also waken up (3am) on a couple of occasions by a "hammering-like" noise coming from the unit above which seems to be on during our entire stay. The noise wasn't so bad, it's more noticeable inside the bathroom but I tend to be more sensitive to abnormal noise. Spoke to the front desk manager about the noise but he reassured there was no renovation in the building during my stay and was offered to move to a different room immedately which was nice, but didn't cause it is too much hazzle. Upon the last day, we were given a complementry late checkout at 12:30 instead of the 11am despite it was a busy Friday which was very much appreciated when travelling with a younger child. One small hiccup during checkout, however, as we were charged a $13.44 daily resort fee which was never mentioned on the booking or on the hotel's website - explained to the staff and she quickly removed it; seems like the resort fee must be newly introduced. Overall a good stay, however will stay at other properties on the strip w/ similar setup (suite w/ kitchenette) such as Vdara or Cosmopolitian in our next visit, since "no resort-fee" is not a competitive advantage anymore...

Reviews.Title: “Showing some Wear and Tear...”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyWebb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel about a year ago and unfortunately the last year has not been kind to Palms Place!! The hotel is still fairly new (only a few years old) and the rooms were designed very well including an in-room kitchen with dishwasher and fridge (blender, coffee maker, utensils, etc.) and modern decor. Its toiletry products are all supplied by Aveda which is fantastic! However... The place is starting to show some wear and tear that requires maintenance and cleaning that is not being done properly! - A black hair on the clean white bedsheets - missing marble tile in the bathroom - chalking peeling off the wall in the shower - dirty carpet - stains on the walls - ice machine in room didnt work I called for a comforter and blanket, they brought me only a blanket. Big glass window near elevators was full of greasy hand prints the ENTIRE stay.. never cleaned. Obviously the recession is continuing to hit the hotel hard and its clear that they are cutting back on maintenance and cleaning staff to try and keep costs down.

Reviews.Title: “WOWWWWWW”
Reviews.Author: mrnngg
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Such an amazing room for a 4 star suite. I was actually upgraded to this because I prefer a higher up room. It did not disappoint. In fact, it had 2 TVS, a full sofa a queen size bed, a mini kitchenette, a sink and a bath and shower. For what I paid.. it was worth probably 5 times. I'm not very picky in my hotels but I must say this room felt like royalty considering it was less than some other high end hotels. Only qualm I have is it is very far from the strip and as a result I did not have the energy to walk the couple of miles.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for $600 suite, dirty room and slept next to vomit smell!”
Reviews.Author: AD_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: I had booked the one bedroom suite at Palms Place for $600+ as a special treat for my wife's birthday. We went for dinner at one of the restaurants and dropped $300 for a fantastic meal. We also purchased the $70 x2 wrist bands to walk right into the four onsite clubs. Finally the next morning we had $750 worth of Spa treatments booked at Drift Spa. My point is that we were not concerned about money for that night. When we first entered the room, we were blown away by the facilities and the view from the 51st floor. BTW though the suites have balconies, guests do not have access due to "issues". If you pay more and get a penthouse, those issues seem to disappear. At least that was the upsell at the front desk. After being in the room a while we started to notice things.... -Sticky red liquid that had dried on the floor -Lots of scuff marks on the beautiful white tub that rubbed off with a thumb -Hair that was not ours (For Sure) all over the place and on the white robes -Picked up a wrapped soap from the soap disk to find hair under it Regardless, we are pretty easygoing and decided to make a quick stop at the front desk to resolve the issues. After all mistakes to happen! We explained the issues to the front desk and clearly heard our complaints communicated to housekeeping by the front desk. We headed off to dinner happy to know that the issues will be resolved. After dinner we returned back to the room so my wife could change her heels and freshen up for dancing and fun in the casino. Nothing had been done, but housekeeping did put new robes on the tub. No, they did not remove the old robes or take the hairs off them. They left everything exactly the same way and just gave us new robes. We did not want to complain again that night, so we decided to point it out the next day. So we had a good time out and spent quite a bit of money on expensive $15 drinks. Who cares, we are having fun! We return to our room and expect to have a great night when my wife says " Honey I'm sorry, but all I smell is vomit on myside of the bed". Sure enough, it smells horrible on her side of the bed. At 3:30 am we call the front desk and complain and tell them we need to move. They move us from the 51st floor to the 8th floor. We have the identical room and honestly, it was a little dusty but we were exhausted. The next morning we get up and notice we have no robes at all in this suite. We complain about our night and get $100 off as that is all the front desk is authorized to do. They told us to definitely come back and see the manger. Fine, lets have a quick bite and head to the spa for our couples massage and facials. My first facial BTW. The spa was top notch and the massage was a dream! We go back to find the manager and wait for about 15-20 min, finally the front desk gives us a couple free drinks while we wait. Finally we see the manager who offers us a couple brunches to compensate for the night. We stayed quiet but to experience a room that smelled like vomit and was dirty and then get a bill for $600 -$100 is not good enough! Regardless, we sucked it up and went home. Even after getting a negative response in the guest survey, they never offered to at a min cover the room costs. A corporate person sent me an email today saying they are dedicated to service blah blah blah and hope we will return and give them another chance. Why would I pay another $600 -$100 to go back there to potentially experience the same thing? Palms is not cheap and is off the strip, they need to be extra good to get business. With out some sort of compensation and incentive, why would I go back there? I have told them, what's done is done, don't worry about it! I recommend staying somewhere else, like Mandalay Bay where we had an awesome time as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMike213
Reviews.Content: all i can is wow it was so confortible we did wanna leave the room everything was perfect 3 tvs (2 42" in the room n a lil 13" n the bathroom) the bathroom was beatiful top of the line on everything in the room even a mini bar (if u care) the only downside is the balcony door wont open new company policy but it was all good bout a 5 to 10 min walk to the palms thru a nice cooled moving walkway would defintly stay here agian one of the best hotels in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Put on your walking shoes!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleST
Reviews.Content: This is not a case of location location location ! Unless you plan on renting a car do NOT waste your time. The location is horrible and the atmosphere was so dark and dreary I could not wait to get away from the place. The entire "theme" unlike most of the other casinos/hotels was dark brown. Yep color. Instead of architecture or a rich design or ACTUAL theme.. like the rest of vegas that captivates you, this was more like a funeral home. You are greeted by a LARGE dark brown wall..followed by never ending dark brown hallways that lead to a dark room. Just not up to par for Vegas. The second I would leave my room and taxi somewhere else I immediatly felt better. Nothing great for restaurants. Just average. The room itself was clean but the fruitflys landing on my toothbrush made me literally gag . We were told by someone down in the lobby area there was a free continental breakfast upstairs and when we got up there, no sign of it anywhere. A yougurt parfait,an egg sandwhich, a tomatoe juice and a coffee $50! The ONLY decent thing was the bed was very comfortable. This hotel damn near ruined my whole trip. NEVER again!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: coz2006ster
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Palms Place I had no idea what I was in store for. At check in I met someone with the same birthday as me behind the counter, he was very good conversationalist. After walking what seemed to be blocks (only downfall) to my room, I cried in joy. I had a studio that was much like a contemporary apartment. It was comfortable, had appliances I never had in a room before. I felt very much like a rich girl. The Ghost bar is a must see, 55 stories high and a fantastic view of the entire city on a balcony. This is a must stay! Treat yourself

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel....But it has flaws!”
Reviews.Author: er9804
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Palms Casino. When me and a few friends check in, it was no problem! We got to our room, and everything was clean and its its place. But if you look closer they're are some things that not not right! First, when I thought this hotel getting really good I sit down on the sitting area of the living room. Next to my feet was a big puke stain on the carpet. I dont think even the cleaning crew cleaned it because it was crusty and they try to hide it under a piece of furniture! Second the tv from the living did not work, it didnt even turned on. So a repair guy or as Palms Place call them "engineer' came in and took care of the problem quick. Third, after the engineer left we realize that our ice machine from our freezer did not make ice. So we called front desk and they told us they were sending the"engineer" to fix it. instead I think he gave up and told front desk to just bring us ice from room service. Also you can see the wear and tear on the walls and wooden floors. The main thing that bother me mainly was the location. Its pretty far from the strip. So I felt limited in time! They should offer a free shuttle to the strip. i felt like I missed the whole Vegas experience staying here! next time no doubt about it am staying at the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Completely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jupitersmoon
Reviews.Content: The staff here is outright incompetent and unprofessional. I booked one of the larger suites for a special occasion that I was combining with some business. I called ahead and made arrangements with the concierge to have $300 dollars worth of roses and a gift basket placed in the room, as this stay was a surprise for my companion. I even called ahead and emailed the desk staff with instructions about the roses and expressed details that this was meant to be a surprise. Well… When we arrived an hour after the hotel’s scheduled check in- time, we were told that our room was not ready and that it would be about another half hour before it is. We were directed to the hotel’s swank looking lobby bar and ordered two drinks. The bartender actually asked if I had drink comp tix. When I said no, she said that was ok, no charge, the desk should have given us some. But since we were literally the ONLY guests in the bar/lobby it wasn’t such a big deal. I handed her $10 anyway. 45 mins later the desk agent actually SHOUTS across the lobby that our room was now ready. When we went to collect the room keys the desk agent actually looks directly at my companion and asks “I think some flowers arrived for you. You want those delivered to your room?” Surprise ruined! I glared at the clerk and asked her to please read the reservation notes. She did and stared back with indifference. No apology! Just an “opps”. I mean…REALLY people?!?! On to the room…After figuring out the elevator keys with no help from the staff we arrived at our room only to find the maid still in there rushing around like a crazy person. I actually felt sorry her she looked so stressed. I told her to take her time, we’ll just sit and wait for the roses, our luggage, etc. The maid was gone within a few mins, but it took the luggage almost a half hour, and the roses ANOTHER 20mins to get to the room after several inquiries down to the desk. The freezer (a sub zero appliance) did not work, so there was no ice which sucks when its 110 outside. The furnishings are like IKEA rejects…very modern…which in reality translates to cheap. It all looks cool, especially in the photos. But in person the quality is obviously lacking. There is dust behind almost everything. But I suppose this is the desert…The air bubble spa never worked and went off with an ear-piercing “swoosh” in the middle of the night. It was shocking and did not shut off until a maintenance guy got up to the room 20mins after I called down to the desk, and this was after 3am. But the room does have some redeeming qualities. The wrap around balcony is awesome! The higher up floors do have a really great view. The bed was nice, TVs great, and the fire place is a nice touch. The Drift Spa is pathetic. They had no bottled or filtered water to offer any guests. “They were out”. In California that is a violation of Spa establishment laws. Imagine not having any water after getting out of a steam room or sauna. The “Turkish Hamman” is not a true Hamman, for you world travelers out there who know better. And the staff would not stop attempting to up-sale me, even when I asked her to stop. It was very obnoxious. There are much better spas in Vegas! The Simon Restaurant is on par with any Wolfgang Puck joint. Nice décor, nice view of the pool. Overpriced, but delicious food and drink. Service was prompt and the hostess was practically topless… several nipple slips in a matter of seconds…so no need to visit any strip-clubs. I wanted to complain to the management, but time is money and I decided to let it go. Life is too short to be pissed off. That’s what TripAdvisor is for right? This is not a 4 or 5 star property. There are clearly serious problems with the management and the staffing. It’s all very plastic and inauthentic. I strongly suggest you avoid staying at the Palms Place!

Reviews.Title: ““Peace and Freedom””
Reviews.Author: Bimmercando
Reviews.Content: Date of review: 22 Feb 2011 This is where you can feel like you're not in a cramped hotel room but rather in your own apartment/condo like setting. No noise from casinos. Never needing to walk through a cigarette smoke smelling casino to reach your room. Easy simple in/out self parking and valet. No 20 minute waits for your car. Your on the road in no time. You maintain control. You want to hit the casino....moving sidewalk takes you from the hotel to the casino ( sportsbook and food court/theatre end ) in three minutes or so. Rooms are perfect. For those that don't want to eat every meal or breakfast at one of the many fine hotel eateries, the room is fully equipped. All kitchen appliances, utensils, dishwasher, refrigerator, etc etc - Housekeeping takes care.... No TV shortages here either ! Multiple wall flat screens and anohther in the washroom for company. Front desk staff are top notch. Lobby bar staff are great ( not to mention extremely attractive ). The spa, gym and workout rooms are bright and well staffed and not tucked away on a basement floor. Simon's for meals is the place for just about anything that isn't too heavy. They accomodate to special needs and have a great bar sitting area as well. The pool and staff will keep you from drying out in season. What more can I say ? If I say more I may risk my future stays being amidst too many guests? p.s. - Ask for a room facing the strip as often rooms facing S. Arvilee St ( the back ) get the beeping from lift trucks backing up and unloading in the nearby company's warehouse lots.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: carpediem34
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palms place for my 21st birthday weekend. My boyfriend and I stayed in the studio suite which was plenty big with great contemporary furnishings. The bathroom was very contemporary also, loved the shower and jacuzzi tub; Except the water would leak out of the shower but was easily fixed by a towel. The bed was comfortable, which was furnished with tons of pillows. There are two flat screens which are huge! A couch which sits right next to the large windows which look out onto the strip. There is also a fully stocked kitchen which would be great if you'd like to spend less on food. This was my first time in Vegas so I cannot differentiate between staying on the strip or off, but I figure next time I will stay on the strip since the Palms is sorta small and there isnt much around it. Cabs were about $13 each way to the strip. But if you want a dose of reality with a beautiful room in Vegas and aren't on a budget, Palms place is your place.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Surprise”
Reviews.Author: jclark702
Reviews.Content: Up until about a year ago, I lived in Las Vegas and worked in the hospitality industry. I decided it was time to come "home" and visit with my friends. My travel dates were from March 5th - 12th. I have always been a fan of Sunday Margarita Brunch at Gardunos and decided I would book the 5th at The Palms, and then move to Trump International for the rest of my stay. Thanks to trip advisor, I knew to book in the Fantasy Tower. I am 30 years old and still like to go out, but I admit that I wasn't sure about staying here right before MTV was due to kick off spring break. Check in was very easy, no lines, and when I confirmed with the front desk agent that I was in the fantasy tower, I was told that the fantasy tower was sold out and I had been upgraded to Palms Place! This was fabulous news as I had actually considered Palms Place when booking my vacations. I wanted something that was a mixed use development (condo-tel), and narrowed down my choices to Vdara, Signature, Trump International, and Palms Place. In the end, Trump won and it was fabulous, but for the mean time, I was excited to see the competition. The trek to Palms Place was interesting. We had to use the "sky tube" and the elevator to the second floor wasn't working. Luckily I had a friend to help me lug one of my two 45 pound suitcases up to the second floor. Casinos have gotten better in their designs of getting guests from check in to their rooms. Mirage, Caesars, Treasure Island...I hate walking through a casino FOREVER with my luggage. That was kind of the situation here, but in all fairness, it was only because it was basically a relocation. My room was a studio on the 39th floor, overlooking the mountains to the west. I had a balcony that did not open. The sink at the bar did not work either. There was certainly nothing that was a "deal breaker" and I was just excited that I had been given an upgrade. The room was very nice, I loved the hardwood floors and carpeted seating area. Great use of space for sure. My friend and I discovered the dishwasher hidden under the desk/breakfast nook, and that was funny. The bathroom was... interesting. The tub is behind the shower, but I like the frosted glass wall against the tub that went into the bedroom. It reminded me of Shadow Bar at Caesars. The TV in the bathroom was nice, and had a DVD player in it. The sink in the bathroom has a design flaw. If you turn the water on too high, you are likely to splash everywhere. Every encounter I had with staff was great, ESPECIALLY at Gardunos. I made a reservation for brunch for 6 at 1030am on Sunday. Come Sunday morning, a friend of mine called and said they had to add 3 more!! I have seen people line up for this brunch, and was hoping there wouldn't be an issue. I called the operator and was told that reservations for the restaurant would not be open until they opened at 1030am. She said, "let me see what I can do" and put me on hold for a few minutes. When she came back on the line she said she had gotten a hold of the chef and he said it wouldn't be a problem, and to just say he said so! I was very impressed. I wish the balcony had opened, it was kind of disappointing that it was kept locked. Overall, it was a great stay for one night, and I would come back again IF Trump was sold out. If you are looking for a room with a residential feel, I urge you to check out Trump International.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, nice room, if you don't mind things not working”
Reviews.Author: JessicaHills
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night with my 3 year-old daughter. The hotel staff was VERY UNHELPFUL and even RUDE. Probably because we weren't single and had a child (even though she is VERY well-behaved.) When we checked in they were less than helpful and acted annoyed that we got our reservation from JetSetter.com. We even paid almost as much as the hotel charges so I don't understand why that even mattered. They failed to mention that we had 2 complimentary breakfasts. Their website also said that the pool was open the week before we arrived, but it was still closed for the winter (even with temps over 80 degrees) This was half the reason we were staying here for the night. The room was nice, but there were quite a few things not working (including the DO NOT DISTURB light) We were put into a room without the view of the strip even though there were MANY vacancies with a view. The fire alarm went off while we were there with a loud voice advising us to leave the room and take the stairs (we were on the 34th level) We found out that it was just because someone had smoked outside of their room in the hotel so apparently any time that happens (which I assume is a lot) you will be alarmed with an extremely loud siren and have to leave your room immediately. Also, I tried to call room service and they never answered the phone.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a joke! Stay on the strip at a real 5-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LASteve1977
Reviews.Content: Not even close to a 4 or 5 star experience. I stayed in a master one bedroom suite with my wife for the Valentines day weekend. The View was amazing. And the bathroom was really nice. Other than that, would rather stay at a motel 6 than ever go back here! It was noisy! The Bed sheets had urine stains on them. The management didn't care about us or our problems. Black out shades, didn't black out anything! IF you're going to spend this much money go the The Wynn, or City Center. Palm's Place is all hype and a big letdown. DON'T STAY HERE!!!!!! YOU WON'T SLEEP!!!! PLACE IS POORLY DESIGNED AND WAY TO NOISY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its ok”
Reviews.Author: jbsun4442
Reviews.Content: the rooms are smaller than they said...overall it wasn't that this was a bad hotel just not as nice as some other palaces we have stayed at

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: mzchitownchic
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for my bday weekend 2 couples we had 2 studio suites ages 22-32 we had a blast the hotel actually look better than the pics we didnt have any problems during our stay they do require $200 for accidental fees but you get it back at check out its a lil off the strip but it was ok for us we did so much margaritaville has the best margaritas in the WORLD! we did the gondola ride at the venetian, we saw Zumanity at NYNY we went to sapphire(strip club) got on the rides at the top of the stratosphere, we went to the gun store,we went to tha max museum,checked out damn near all the hotel and their activities cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_girl59
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience with this hotel. Stayed in a studio room with a great view of the strip. Room was very clean and looked just like the pictures on the hotel website. The kitchenette provided everything that you would need to prepare a meal. Bathroom was incredible! A walk-in rain shower area and a seperate jacuzzi bathtub...divine! Ordered room service one morning - prompt and delicious! It is about a mile from the strip but getting there is no problem. Cabs are always available either just outside of the lobby or outside of the main Palms Hotel (take the indoor skytube or walk across the property). There was no room to room noise that I noticed but I did hear noise/doors slamming from the hallway. A very minor negative. All of the staff on the Palms property were always very courteous and helpful; great service! No bad surprises with the bill or room. Would definitely return on my next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dusty, but worse of all terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: rjkazoo
Reviews.Content: We rented the two bedroom suite for my daughters birthday...upon checkin we found the room to be dirty and dusty. Broken lightbulbs and very little lighting in the room. We chose this room because of the view, the kitchen and the set up to have people over for my daughters birthday. We invited 15 guests to join us for pizza and cake... but upon there arrival we were told that there was a 4 person max per room!!!!! I explained that we weren't having excess people stay the night but up for cake for my daughters birthday! I'm a 45 year old responsible adult that was respectful and quiet. Our guests had to leave because security and the front desk harrassed us for hours. I've never been so embarrassed and when we asked what we were doing wrong all the staff could say is that there's a 4 person max in each room. WE were told that "the rooms were to sleep in not socialize" STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 1st experience in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: madagou
Reviews.Content: It was my 1st time in Vegas, so we went to the Palms!! We were in the Palm Fantasy Tower and honestly it was simply awesome!!!! We were at the 26th floor, the room was really big, comfy, the bathroom was so so nice, an amazing view! If you want to use internet you have to pay, it was a little bit strange cause when you pay the price that you have to, it's supposed to be included... But next to the slots, you can connect to the wifi, so it's ok. During our stay, there was a Playboy party at the 34th floor, it was cool but nothing exceptional, but the funny thing was by taking stairs you can go the Moon, another club more trendy, so cool!!! The pool was closed because of the low season! The casino was not really crowded, except for the tables... 1st good experience in Vegas!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty to do from Playboy Club to Ditch Friday Pool Partys”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Columbus
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at Palms Place. We got a great deal upgrading our room to the two bedroom penthouse and headed straight for the Pool Party. After a huge day and night we kicked back during the day. Palms Place is in a great spot, not on the strip but set back to take the amazing strip view by night, only a short taxi ride in. Previous to staying at the Palms we stayed at Ceasers Palace and the service was terrible, they certainly treat you like just another number. However our experience in the Palms was a vast improvement, certainly be back to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Casino/Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DJSteve4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palms Place in a one bedroom suite. Amazing room, great view, and a great value. The room was huge with spectacular views. Been to Palms Place many times, never once had a problem. Pool was closed for the season, which was the only let down. Went to the spa instead.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be if you want off the strip but not totally isolated”
Reviews.Author: materielgrrl
Reviews.Content: I have to say if the W could set up a resort hotel it would be Palms Place. I had quite an enjoyable time for four days this past weekend. My sisters and I stayed there for a shopping weekend in Vegas. The first thing I liked, it was a hotel, it had a lobby, very comfortable chairs to sit in while waiting to check in - or check out to wait for my shuttle to take us to the airport. The staff was great, the ladies and gentleman who check you in are very knowledgeable, and can answer your questions, not just the question but try to get where you are going with what you are asking. I found out that instead of going to the spa each morning to work out, if I went down stairs to the front desk each morning I got a complimentary pass - not free but it was 9.99 plus tax to workout and sue the spa facilities. They have excellent workout facilities, even the pilates machines and classes. One of the guests had a personal trainer there, who came over to make sure I used the machines right. I had a great workout and at 7:30 in the morning, the whirlpool all to myself. The spa staff were great very friendly and helpful each day. The room we stayed in was a one bedroom suite, a lot like a W. We were short a few items, but each time we called room service, our staffer was there with what we needed rather quickly. Again it was a very relaxing hotel experience. I have no complaints. I'm not a celebrity gawker, but Palms Place is walking distance to the Palms casino hotels. While there Hugh Hefner rolled in for his 88th B-day, and a more polite well spoken version of Sami from Jersey Shore was there too, there were others, but I don't know who they were, they were treated as a guest (with a little bit of security for everyones privacy) just like the rest of us. I think the Maloof's have figured out the perfect formula for casino, gaming, partying and lounging in Vegas. Sunday brunch at the Palms was pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, but dirty!”
Reviews.Author: docjennings
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a two bedroom suite (actually a one bedroom suite attached to a second bedroom) with sweeping views of the strip. The place was ultra modern and very cool which I normally really like. I realized that I was probably in somone's owned condo as there was a private locked closet. I have to say it was very dirty! The decor is so dark that every stain in the hallways, every mark on the wall (and there were many) really stuck out. The corners where the carpet met the walls were collecting dirt and dust and the balcony was sticky from previous partying. I dont know if housekeeping just missed this room or what but really wasnt up to speed when I pay this rate in other hotels. Beds were awesome as others have said - really awesome. Room service - quite unbelievable - I ordered a bottle of champagne and some shrimp cocktail and they were at the door in 5 minutes! The hotel itself is great, private, cool, great breakfast, etc. BUT I would hesitate staying there again with all the dirt and dust..it was almost like you could see the party that had been there the night before. Suggestion: Put a coffee pot and some coffee in these suites!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Kisspl
Reviews.Content: Anybody that complains about the palms place must be crazy. I was so happy with my suite and how clean the room was. Awesome view and the staff was so nice and friendly. It was my sixth time in Vegas and that was the best stay I ever had. I will definitely stay there again. Other hotels should learn from the palms place staff and see how clients should be treated

Reviews.Title: “Excellent suite...and far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: TheRichens2
Reviews.Content: Booked into a one bedroom suite for four nights and had our expectations exceeded. Firstly the suite itself was superb. Contemporary, very chic but with all the practical touches you need that differentiates a place like this from a hotel room (great kitchen, washing facilities, etc). The room we had had panoramic views from the balcony of the Strip, which were stunning at night. It's just a shame there isn't any furniture allowed onto the balconies so you can make the most of them. The link to the Palms hotel and its facilities is good and if you are lucky enough to have a decent band playing during your stay definitely go to the in house venue, the Pearl, as it's excellent (as were LCD Soundsystem!!). The pool is small but perfectly formed. Only tried the bar at the main entrance which looks a bit incongruous, but is actually very good. Negatives? You should be aware that the Strip is a $10-12 cab ride away, which was perfect for us, but might come as a surprise to some. Also, the wireless fees are unnecessarily high, although we softened the blow by taking the 5 day access for $50, instead of the normal daily rate of $15. The standard of cleanliness of the suite was only average - when we checked in there was graffiti on one of the windows from a previous guest that hadn't been seen or cleaned. Not great. They also kindly left us a pair of their (thankfully clean) underwear, which the cleaners should have found. In short though, for the price we paid, this place was superb overall and I'd highly recommend it. We'd definitely book back in next time we're in Vegas. I'd especially like to big-up Darren, the Aussie in charge of the bell boys. Friendly, superbly efficient, he's also a top bloke.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dukes24-7
Reviews.Content: Great Studio room, Great view, Lobby area nice, pool area nice, however better pool is across at the palms, 5min across via the sky bridge. A little bit off from strip but only 7-10S in taxi.. Great for Palms Pool party every friday you have to go, you get priority for hotel guests and get early allowing you to get your seats. Casino in palms in great, but nightlife makes up for it with Ghostbar, Playboy club, Rain and Moon. Cant wait to go back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and spa”
Reviews.Author: simchah3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend here. We had a wonderful room with a great view of the Las Vegas strip. I had a relaxing massage in the spa and I thought the prices were reasonable. I would definitely recommend this hotel and spa to my friends. I would not recommend the Sunday Brunch- it's way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE IF YOU WANT TO HAVE FUN”
Reviews.Author: regina0918
Reviews.Content: I try to be a pretty positive person, so for me to actually take the time to write a scathing review online is pretty serious. To keep this short, we were promised a lot of things by the hotel and they just did not deliver. We went there for my bachelorette party and it was fun but the staff at Palms Place made it hard for us to enjoy ourselves because the of the lack of communication between staff inside the hotel! The front desk person didn't even know they name of the concierge when I was describing her. Unbelievable. We were offered a free cabana with the room and were were bascially kick out of the cabana because we "didn't have a reservation" even after we explained that we did. We either had to pay $150 or leave. So we left. The concierge assured us we would get comped at their night club Rain because we were guests at the hotel and we were a group of six girls and again, we weren't on the list. We either had to pay $40 each to get in or leave. So we left. Bottom Line: If you're in Vegas to have a good time and get the kind of service you pay hundreds of dollars for, don't stay here. They make false promises and doesn't care about delivering as long as they've got your credit card number in their records.

Reviews.Title: “amazing rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: tahlz22
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for our wedding night & were very very happy with the one bedroom suite, sooo flash! the hotels pool & spa amenities are really nice aswell. the biggest downfall for this hotel is its location, too far off the strip to walk, so you need to catch a taxi if you want to get into the action, & the onsite casino at the palms is pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Katiejam
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are nice! and the bathrooms are especially nice. The tubs, showers and tvs were a huge hit with colleagues. I could have happily stayed in my room and never left. The restaurants were a little pricey and it was hard to come by a good cup of coffee in the morning for a reasonable price. But I was pleased with they stay. Totally worth it if you're ok with tolerating a younger, hipper crowd. Expect lots of girls who forgot their pants to be walking the halls along with you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: eue552
Reviews.Content: From the time you arrive at the hotel the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are really nice, with 2 tvs and a 3rd in the bathroom. The only thing was that the dishwasher had some glasses in there that looked like they had been there a while. Other than that I would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: costap
Reviews.Content: Although I wanted to stay here I never ended up staying due to the reservations department. The front page of their website prominently lists multiple package promotions. After unsuccessfully trying to book the promotion from the website I called the reservation phone number. The lady on the phone told me that all of the packages showed no availability on any day of any month so she would override it for me in the system. I wasn't sure what package I wanted to I told her I would call back. When I called back I got a different person on the phone and she refused to give me the package price. I asked to speak with the supervisor and when I was connected to Enrique he told me I should have booked with the first agent and refused to give me the package price even though it continues to be advertised on the front page of the website. I feel this is not only bad customer service but also bait-and-switch as they actively advertise packages that they have no intention o giving you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Group”
Reviews.Author: B2Kizzle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palms Place during the last weekend of June for an 8 Person Bachelor Party and was pleased with the Hotel. Our group stayed in a 2-bedroom suite which was more than enough to accomodate our large group. Service I would have to say was mediocre at best, as the hotel lacked the attention to detail that you would find in 5 star accomodations - Still very friendly service staff. Location/Food/Pool were all fantastic, and I would highly reccomend this hotel for a group trip. The Palms hotel which is adjoined to this property via connecting pedway is a very hip hotel with great energy. Value for the room was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for Less”
Reviews.Author: SKTraveler68
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to the Palms Place for a quick mid week getaway and were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The highlights of this hotel are: rooms are all modern suites with kitchenettes, spa is tranquil and all treatments were better than 5 star resorts, staff friendly and extremely helpful, off the strip so quieter but close enough to walk or drive and movie theater and fun clubs right next door at the Palms which is connected by a sky tube. The only con to this hotel is the restaurant Simon is very expensive for mediocre food so definately leave the hotel for better restaurants on the strip. Also pool is small but midweek it was quiet. Great for couples, singles and business travelers not for families.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: davesmith2
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a scheduled late check-in at just before midnight. Walked into lobby and saw about 10 people sitting in lobby with their luggage waiting for their room, not a good sign. Some people had been there as long as 3 hrs. I was told my room was "not cleaned yet". It was obvious they oversold the hotel. I sat in lobby until 2am at which point they put me in a room and then told me that I had to checkout of that room in the morning and transfer my stuff to another room. They stated they would take $50 off my final charge, which they did not do until I reminded them of it. This place is run by idiots, I have never had an experience like that before. I would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice balance in a city of extremes”
Reviews.Author: njfamilyvacation
Reviews.Content: Booked a Studio Suite with a great view of the strip. The Spa was excellent. The pool at Palms Place is smaller and quieter than the main pool at the Palms which provides a nice break from the non-stop party atmosphere on the weekend. Short cab ride to the strip - close enough to get there but far enough away to relax when needed. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jya-Jya
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fancy, modern and very comfortable, luxury bathroom and spacious (I think it could fit 3-4 friends). Pools were great, food was ok. We ate away from the hotel most of the time due to lack of choices in the hotel. I would have given it 5 stars if the nightlife was better. The clubs closed at like 2am and the hotel seemed a little dead during the day/night (compared to what you see of Vegas on tv). We're from NYC so we were a little disappointed in the party scene. C'mon it's Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Not So Special”
Reviews.Author: laa
Reviews.Content: The room is decorated very nicely. There is even a beautifuly white tub in the master bedroom Very pretty place with great views. This location was picked for the full kitchen and fridge. We were having guest in our room on a regualr and needed the beer and wine to be cold. The only people that seemed to know we were alive we the doormman and the valet person. The other hotel staff was not the least be concerned with me or my request. If they could not provide something, it was just too darn bad, they did not apologize or try to make amends. I am a person that cares about the cleanliness of my environment and upon closer inspection I should not have stayed at this place. The lamp shade in the bedroom had dust on the inside that had to have been there for at least 6 months, and there were cobwebs all over. We had peanuts and so the skins were on the wood floor when we left the room and were there when we returned, so it was clear that the maid only changed the towels and made the bed. No sweeping or dusting after the first night of our stay. It is really a shame because the place is really nice and special if only cleaner and staffed with people that care and are trained in Excellent Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with Vegas like amentities”
Reviews.Author: BrandonUK07
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the 2BR suite with a strip view. First let me say that not all rooms have a strip view, so I highly recommend to request this type of room, otherwise, you're facing the mountains. I traveled with a group of 6 guys for a bachelor party and this was the perfect setup. We have a kitchen, fridge and 2.5 baths. We stopped at the local supermarket on the way in to pick up food and liquor which worked out nicely given the room had everything we needed to cook which saved us $$$. The casino is on average a 5-10 minute walk which isn't too bad. If you're looking to have a night out at the Palms, it is recommended to speak with concierge so they can connect you with a host. We were able to get 6 guys into Moon nightclub with free entry, no wait line and our own table and bottle for $570 tax, tip incl. The bathrooms at this hotel were amazing, the best I've seen in Vegas. In summary, if you're looking for a young, hip place with contemporary feel and great value, Palms Place is the way to go. It is off the strip which some may view as a disadvantage, but in all honestly, its only a $10 taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious/beautiful Hotel with everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: sugarplumshoes
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I were on a trip to see the concert at the Palms Casino Pearl theater but we decided to stay at Palms Place instead because of the space that it offers (full kitchen+3TVs!+aveda shampoo,bath wash, cute living room area) great experience with the friendly staff overall - valet (free), check-in counter, and room service etc. View was spectacular (23rd floor studio) and we wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Palms Resorts The Most Disrespectful To Solo Women Travellers Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: yourvictorygirl
Reviews.Content: Last year I had an incident which they, I feel wrongs me, and did not apologize. This year, my first night there which was March 31st at about 8:30 p.m. Report No. [--] (I was there for www.Vivalasvegas.net) a guy tried to steal my purse while I was big time gambling at the nickel slots. I was trying to deal with a voucher that wasn't going in the machine correctly and when I sat down, I saw my purse (which was on the seat on my left) was gone. I jumped up and looked down the isle and saw a drunkish guy down the isle with a lump under his shirt. I started SCREAMING "Somebody help me! That man (I was pointing) stole my purse! You can see it under his shirt!" So of course not one single person helped me. I figured the Palms must have tons of under-cover security around. Where were they? So I grabbed the man and grabbed my purse and then I tried hold on to him (I am such a goober.) I was screaming the whole time "Help me! Help me!" To make a long story short, he kept pushing me off him and we make it out side where finally a security guy side heard me screaming and he came to help. The drunk guy wasn't trying to leave very much till the guy said "Do you want us to arrest him?" and then he shot the hell out of dodge. I yelled at the security guard. "No, he is just being a thief. But I want to know where the [--] YOUR security was when I was wrestling with him in the casino?" He said he didn't know if what I was saying was true. So we went inside (thief long gone). The video camera plus reports from dealers verified what I was saying. They gave me a diet Coke and then disappeared! I talked to the floor manager the next day at noon and you know what he said? He said security is not for our personal safety! It is for the house not getting ripped off! Can you believe that crap? I went to the Orleans and asked the security there is that how this security thing works and their mouths dropped to the floor. They said they could not believe he said that to me. They said at the Orleans they most likely would have paid for my stay or upgraded my room. He just could NOT BELIEVE the manager said security was NOT THERE for our safety. That is what the man said. I will NEVER EVER EVER stay their again. Last year, the same security guy who took my report on the 3rd was the same guy that accused me of being underage and pretending to be of age and playing the machines. When he saw my id, insteading of apologizing, he said I should be flattered! No matter he yelled at me in front of all the guests. The casino manager said the same thing. They never apologize there. I will NEVER EVER stay there again. As long as I live I will make sure people know how they treated me and what they said.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tristan017
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas over 100 times and this hotel is one of the best. My recent 2 night stay here was flawless. Friendly and quick check in. Beautiful modern suite with an Outside Balcony and panoramic views of the entire strip. The interiors of the suites are outstanding. My room had very good air quality and no build up of cleaning product smells you find in many hotel rooms. One of the nicest and largest bathrooms I have ever had in a hotel. Terrific meal at Simons restaurant downstairs. Unobtrusive and efficient housekeeping. Free parking right in front of the hotel. Terrific Spa. I would highly recommend this hotel to people who want an upscale smoke free Las Vegas experience. It does help to have a car to get around from this hotel back to the strip but it is a very short cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “What hospitality is all about...”
Reviews.Author: ThisPromoWorks
Reviews.Content: Had the smarts to really dig and decided to stay at Palms Place for a three night business trip. the rates were ridiculously low since i was there Monday through Thursday. upgraded to a one Bedroom suite and loved it. staff at Spa, Simon, and front desk were top notch and attentive. i will be staying there if it is affordable every tie i go back to Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Greate Suite at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: mandlinsocal
Reviews.Content: I called to book a standard room at the Palms for a business trip and was told that for $10 more per night (about $250) we could upgrade to a 1200 sq ft suite. It was a no brainer. The suite was basically an apartment with a separate private master bedroom, very comfortable beds, 2 baths, living room with fireplace, plasma TVs, a full kitchen and a great view of the city. It was far more space and luxury than what we needed but well worth an extra $20 for the weekend. I was wishing my girlfriend was with me instead of my business partner. We were there during convention time and that meant higher minimum tables so I didn't gamble as much as I usually would. The Palms is modern Vegas all the way with fast paced play, crowded bars and more of a young party vibe. Aside from things getting crowded and the long walk from the Palms Place tower to the casino our stay was perfect. We had all our meals at the hotel including breakfast, lunch, dinner and late night snacks and everything we ordered was good as was the service all around. I've been getting promo offer emails since the trip and may take advantage of the deals. Great room, great food and a good value. No complaints about the prices. I may not choose to gamble here but would definitely stay at the Palms again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: EQ80
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is good, the room we were eventually given was beautiful but the whole experience was stressful and annoying. Upon arrival no-one was there to help with our bags, if we only had one or two suitcases I wouldn't have minded. However, we were left to struggle with 2 large suitcases, 2 carry on bags 4 shopping bags. Reception staff were un-friendly and not helpful, no information offered on the hotel's amenities etc. When we got to our room the smell of cigarrettes almost made me vomit and there were 2 double beds. I specifically booked a king room on a non smoking floor. So I phoned reception and the guy basically told me he had no rooms available that met my requirements. After umming and ahhhing he miraculously found one and said a bell boy would be up asap to give us the keys for the new room. We had to wait in the hall because the room smelled like a filthy ashtray and my head was spinning. 15 minutes later I called reception to inquire about the keys, I was assured that he was coming. 25 minutes later still nothing so I spoke to a manager and told him I was completely un-impressed by our experience with the hotel and staff. The bell boy finally materialised, hurriedly shoved the keys in my husband's hands before running off - no offer to help with our bags or show us the new room. There is more to this hideous experience but to be honest I just want to forget about the whole thing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, but be aware of the crowd”
Reviews.Author: RiotPelaaja
Reviews.Content: Palms Place is part of the Palms complex and offers really awesome, large rooms with a nice metallic kitchen that I'm sure no one ever uses. The bathroom's are really nice with plenty of space and also a large bathtub and a separate shower area next to it. The wall separating the living room from the bathroom is not made of concrete, but sort of plastic, so while you only see shapes behind it, if you turn on the lights in the bathroom, it lights up the living room pretty well, which was a bit annoying to the person sleeping in the dark living room while the other one was taking the shower. I really like the metallic finish of the kitchen and the dark wooden floors instead of the usual thick carpets US hotels have, nice darkwood floor is so much better. The bed and the sofa are very comfortable. The sofa could be turned into a large bed which was comfier than most regular beds in Best Wester and other average hotels. The balcony is large and ours had great view towards the strip. There's a ridiculous two HD tv's in the room and plenty of table space for your stuff and enough closet space too. The kitchen table is surrounded with a few really nice chairs and this was great are to use your laptop and get some work done. So, the room was great, but the fact that you get charged 30$ a day for gym and shower use at the spa was ridiculous for a hotel of this standard. Also, wifi costs 15$ day, but 21$ for a month, so...obvious choice there. The lobby bar at the Palms Place is actually quite comfy and nice as were the bartenders. Now the hotel does have a certain crowd, people really seemed to be concentrating in showing themselves off, so it isn't the most relaxed place around especially at the Palms various clubs where most people concentrated looking good rather than having fun. The strip is only a 10$ cab ride away and there's a Starbucks and some stores across the Palms Place, so location-wise, the hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “Such a wonderful deal”
Reviews.Author: ClumsyIsis
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was not directly on the strip, it was such a bargain. For the same cost on the strip, you'd be staying at the Excalibur. Check in was very smooth. The front desk offered up information on how to get to the Palms. From the Palms proper (and not Palms Place), there is a shuttle that will take you back to the strip for free. On the way back, you can catch the shuttle at the Paris, Bally's, or Caesar's. Our room was nice. We stayed in a studio suite. It had a large kitchenette type area. The bathroom was awesome. Large hot tub, great shower, TV in the bathroom. The beds were large and extremely comfortable. There was a nice large balcony with a great view of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations. Would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: eclmdl
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why people have negative things to say about the Palms Place, we had a fantastic experience there. We went to Vegas with the intention to get away from our two young children. The Palms Place was perfect for that. When we showed up, we were the only people in the lobby checking in. The front desk girl was super friendly, gave us the best room she had available and gave us a Simon Dining Package for the same price she was going to charge us for our room ($199 for a 1-bedroom suite). The room was big with modern decor and we loved the bathtub in the master bedroom right in front of the window. The tub fit the two of us comfortably and we were able to sit in it and have a perfect view of the strip from the Stratosphere to the Mandalay Bay. The bathroom is quite luxurious also with a rain shower plus two additional shower heads. The bed was comfortable too. We ate dinner at the Simon restaurant located on the 6th floor which served wonderful food and the service was excellent. When we checked out, there was a problem with the bill, but it was fixed promptly without any arguments. The valet staff were happy and chatty and the concierge was brilliant with his knowledge of the available Vegas shows. In all, the combination of service oriented staff, beautiful room and good food made for a very memorable stay. The front desk girls shared some information on the Palms Place. Apparently they are condos, with each unit owned by an individual who allows the Palms to rent out their space when it is not being used. We found for this reason, all the staff treats you like gold, because they never know if you are an owner, a friend of an owner, or a guest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms and horrible service...”
Reviews.Author: MildaG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palms Place for two nights this week. Hotel is off the strip, but very accessible and not hard to find. Our check in went smoothly and we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and the great views of the strip. The following, however, made our stay at Palms Place one that I would not want to repeat again and would not recommend it to any of my friends: - The lights in the main hallway right by the room entrance were not working, which made it hard to open the door and even harder to find a light switch inside the room. It would have been pretty spooky if I was by myself, but I wasn't scared with my husband by my side. Oh well, I thought I will just call the front desk and have them fix it. Called three times during our stay, but nobody came up to check it out and the light bulbs were not changed. - After walking in the room, we noticed the strange smell. I decided that it is from the cleaners they use and did not pay much attention. However, we noticed later that the cabinets and the kitchen counters were covered in dust! - The mini bar was locked the entire stay. Called the front desk, but my request was completely ignored again. - The next morning I decided to take a bath. Looking for a plug which was nowhere to be found I noticed several pieces of hair on the bottom of the tub. Being the optimist that I am, got some Kleenex and swiped it off. But when the water started to pour, there was more and more hair collecting on top!!!. In shock I called the front desk again and although my complaint was met with apologies from the front desk person, the housekeeper was only send up after I spoke to the manager! And that's all he could offer, a fast housekeeping service, which took about 15 minutes to show up. After the bathroom was cleaned the strange smell I mentioned before has disappeared. - Wrongful charges, mismanaged accounting and rude staff. At the time you reserve a room at Palms Place you credit card is charged for one night of you stay as a deposit for your reservation. It is noted on your reservation that the hotel will hold extra $150.00 on your credit card to cover the incidental charges. What they don't tell you is that it is not a hold, but an actual charge which is later supposed to be returned! The additional charge on my credit card was not $150, but $198, for a reason that the staff could not explain. And my credit card was charged three times more than the balance due on the reservation statement. After calling the accounting department, I was informed that the computer systems were down all this week and that they will not be able to return the wrongful charges for another week. In addition, my call was met with cold and arrogant attitude which I noticed from most of the staff member while staying there. The manager at the accounting department yelled at me for asking too many questions and not listening to her, when I was trying to figure out when and why the money was taken and how it will be refunded. In summation, the hotel staff was unaccommodating, rude and arrogant. The overall vibe was that they are doing you a favor by letting stay here and you cannot ask for stuff to be fixed or wrongful charges returned. Terrible experience, which is not over yet. Have to call regarding the charges by the end of next week...

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Luxury”
Reviews.Author: panictheory
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute under the recommendation of a friend. Upon check in our front desk clerk made casual conversation and even put us in a room that had a fantastic view. The room was fantastic- we appreciated the full sized kitchen. The bathroom was nothing more that top of the line luxury. My only complaint was with our housekeeping. We had robes missing from the bathroom and no one ever came to replace them after calling the front desk twice. Parts of the room were in disrepair- missing moldings and cracks on some of the built ins. We also visited a very nice bistro style restaurant for lunch overlooking the pool that was really good. Our waiter was very laid back and the food was first class- hard to get with a quick lunch. The parking was not great in this location, however valet was always on top of things and all of the staff did a really good job making you feel as if you were a VIP.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Krisbarbie1
Reviews.Content: My balcony overlooked the Vegas strip; the room had a full-functional kitchen with dishes, appliances, etc.; the tub was also a jacuzzi, the shower had a rain shower; the bed was extremely comfortable; the staff was friendly; location was great; the Ghostbar; Little Buddha (sushi place); playboy club; Rain; Moon; everything was spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: nycgirlvegas77
Reviews.Content: Palms Place is one of the best places we have ever stayed. We stayed in a 1 bedroom condo and I must say the condo was exactly as pictured on the website. The staff is friendly and the spa was absolutely wonderful. I have stayed at all the finest hotels on the strip and this place really can give them all a run for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: ScotandHelen
Reviews.Content: We had a 90 minute wait for our room, despite showing up after check in time. Fair enough, this can happen. The front desk was vague on the hotel's amenities and offerings. After getting no call about the room, I went to inquire and surprisingly the room was now free. We were offered bell service with our luggage, and after waiting one hour and 2 calls to the desk, we finally received our luggage. We got a 1 bedroom suite and it was spacious and well appointed. The supposed VIP passes to clubs is a farce. We had to pay for a VIP pass to all clubs, whereas with Caeser's and other big hotels, they look after guests with free entry into their clubs. The people attending the clubs are young and trashy, no sense of style, dress wise or dancing wise. You could find this type of club anywhere in outback AUS or USA. The pool is quite small and just has people lounging around drinking cans of beer and smoking in the pool. Yuck! This is the first time we have stayed off the strip in Vegas, and won't do it again. The strip is where it is happening and you get a better class of guests in the bigger hotels. Disappointed in the Palms Place, it lacked service and professionalism, and seemed to be run on skeleton staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, but not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachlover2213
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a really fun pool area, bars, casino, etc. The room was ok, there are nicer places in Vegas, but it was kept clean. The room was ok, and so was the food. Prices were also good. However, the hotel isn't located directly on the strip. We took taxi's around everywhere anyways, so it wasn't really a problem for us. But for others, it could be. Restaurants were ok and we were satisfied with the room. All in all a fun weekend!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous place!”
Reviews.Author: Durkryu
Reviews.Content: It´s a fantastic place. The room is amazing with 2 LDC TV in front of the (very very big) bed. There is another LCD TV in the bathroom. You can watch TV while is relaxing in the bathtub. The view from the room is fabulous. I advice to take a high floor to get a nice view. The service is perfect too and the food is great although it was expensive. It´s better eat outside the hotel. The high tecnology in the hotel is very impressive from the elevators to the scalators that connect the casino to the hotel. It was a dream stay in this hotel. I hope come back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Prefer the Signature, Palms Place ok but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: KEWLBEANS
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and facility, hotel staff was very good, professional. Housekeeping had not removed food from previous guest, bed was not made up right, some things falling apart/not working, loud noises from plumbing (?), hotel pool was not very warm and closed early, I was charged a $30 fee just to use sauna/gym, room service breakfast was very good but took over an hour to receive. I would recommend based on the ambience but this place needs a little fine tuning before I would return. If you do go, use the self service parking and be sure to ask the concierge to add you to the guest list for the ghostbar as that's worth a visit (go early when the bar opens to avoid a crowd)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon, will never forget!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKDorset
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Palms Place. I had been emailed an offer to upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite, which we took advantage of and i'm so glad we did!! We had an amazing suite, it was huge! And two balconies. one which looked over the vegas strip, this view was amazing at night! Everything in the room was huge, the bed, the shower, the sofa the list goes on. How can i forget the JACUZZI BATH in the bedroom, you could sit in the bath and look out at the view of vegas - just so cool! The hotel was very modern, it had a spa which we got complimentary use of one morning. Not a a huge spa, but had all the amenities you could need, free soft drinks, juice and tea too. All the staff were very friendly. We didn;t get breakfast included in our stay but if you get the tunnel to the neighbour Palms hotel, there is a buffee breakfast there which was resonably priced, all you can eat! The pool area was also lovely, lots of cabanas, a small bar, and funky background music. The only thing i could fault was that we had to get taxi's to and from the strip. And taxi's in vegas are not cheap. The taxi drivers will take you as longer way as possible. Also taxi's won't just drop you off anywhere, only at hotel's. The closest to the Palms is the ballagio, so ask for a taxi there to get to the strip. It was a great start to our honeymoon and I would definatley love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...if you're young and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MakingMoves
Reviews.Content: Hotel is full of "beautiful" people. Young, skinny, bikini clad girls hang out by the pool. Rooms are swank and chic...bathroom is elegant, with marble hot tub, glass enclosed shower and toilet area. Flat screen in the bathroom! You can watch from the tub. White down comforters feel amazing and the balcony is also nice. I love the fact that it has a living room area, complete with sectional, and glass coffee table. Two huge flat screens in the room, with a kitchenette. Rooms are pretty much awesome. Pool is great, just wish it didnt close so early. Hotel is connected to The Palms hotel by a long walk way, so you have access to both hotels' restaurants and casinos. I recommend using the pool and hanging out at The Palms. More action there. The only thing that's annoying is that they charge $30 a day to use their gym. This would be great if you wanted to spend the day using the sauna, hot tub, etc., but if you just want to use the elliptical for 45 minutes, not practical. Also, hotel is not on the main Vegas strip, but there is alot happening at The Palms..so you won't feel out of the loop.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time...”
Reviews.Author: Watertownhotel
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Palms Place... Would recomend it to anyone looking for some great night life and relaxation!!

Reviews.Title: “If You Build It...”
Reviews.Author: yankhit23
Reviews.Content: Decided to give the Palms Place a try because hadn't been to Vegas in over 10 years. Wanted to go with the family, not a huge gambler, so we didn't want to stay on the Strip. If you want the action of the Strip, don't stay here as there is no Casino in the Hotel and is a pretty good distance from the Strip. The Palms Casino is right next door, which you can use the tube to get back and forth if you really have to fulfill your gambling fix. I booked a Studio, but asked for a complimentary upgrade as I was renewing my wedding vows. They obliged. A bottle of champagne and cherries were also sent up to my room, which was a nice surprise. The room was much better than expected. Quite spacious, whirpool bath, beautifully built bathroom with shower, of course, guest bathroom, washer and dryer, which I utlized to the fullest, full kitchen, huge patio on the 51st floor with a great view of the strip. Did I mention the Whirlpool Bath? However, with the good there is usually a little bad. For whatever reason, Palms Place feels that they need to charge you $100 a day for incidentals. $100 a day???? This we were not informed of until we checked in so I had to fork over a $500 hold which could have put a serious damper on your vacation spending if you didn't have it. Wireless Internet is not free. $14.99 a day for the connection, when I balked on that, I was then told of signing up with BOINGO for my stay which was $21.99 for a month and there would be access with it at the Hotel, but if you check BOINGO out you would see that it is a ripoff as well. I passed on both. Used my Blackberry for Internet access and was just fine. The staff was nice and the valet's knew you by name, when you parked there, but if you didn't and utilized the free parking, which I didn't do much since I rented a Benz, they kind of forgot your name. The Cable channels were extremely limted for some reason, and to make matters worse, the first two nights I was there it wasn't functioning properly because of COX cable...so I was told. since I didn't come to Vegas to watch TV, I can give them a pass I guess. There is an automatic $1 a day phone charge, whether you use the phone or not. Talk about nickel and diming you. I would rather them charge you whatever from the get go and then have a clean slate unless you buy a pay per movie, make a long distance call or damage the room or steal the robes. Overall, I was pleased with my stay and would return again, especially if I can get another free upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Hot nights at Palms Place”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_mom_8
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at Palms Place Las Vegas last February. We asked for a room with a view and got a 17th story room facing the strip. The room was perfect, just as depicted on the website. We felt like we had our own LV condo for 3 nights! It was so cool, and I absolutely love the ultra modern, clean design of the furniture and building decor. The room had everything we needed, and everything worked well. We didn't get room service, but did eat at Simon's restaurant three times in the three days we were there. Each time was great, the staff at Simon's were super friendly, and we even met Simon himself twice. The food was fresh and innovative. Next time we go to LV we will definitely stay at the Palms Place again. So much less frouo-frou than so much available on the strip.!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room - Hot & Cold Staff Experiences..”
Reviews.Author: FutureMrsMartel
Reviews.Content: As promised by all previous reviews, the rooms at Palms Place are amazing. My husband and I rented directly through an owner to guarantee our 27th floor full strip view, and it delivered in every way (on a sidenote it was also our second time working through an owner directly for vacation accomodations, and another positive experience and great deal versus booking through the hotel directly). Having visited Vegas several times before, my husband and I weren't worried about being slightly off strip - though the cab bills did add up over the course of the long weekend - so just something to factor into overall budget versus being more centrally located. A couple things that make me reluctant to stay here again: first would be the very young crowd - my husband and I are in our late twenties so are by no means old, but found ourselves overrun by 21-year old groups of guys and girls on the prowl..I was expecting a young, hip crowd, but this was almost too much at times. (This could have been more of an issue versus other times of year, as it was Labour Day weekend..) Second thing that would deter us from staying here again: staff. We had some great experiences with the bell boys, but also some pretty snotty experiences by staff at Simon restaurant and room service (sidenote: our room service table stayed outside our room door for a day and half after we ordered a meal - even with calling down..). All in all, this hotel delivers the trendy boutique hotel vibe in spades, the rooms themselves are amazing, and staff are somewhat hot/cold - but we aren't the type of people to let that affect our stay, so overall we really enjoyed ourselves at Palms Place. Next time, we may return to Signature at MGM instead - felt we had a better overall experience there.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Mix of Relaxation and Excitement”
Reviews.Author: cgb4d
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Palm's Place for 3 nights between 08/10 and 08/14. It was our first trip to Las Vegas and I feel we chose a perfect place to stay.
